https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014703^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014703"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"SMARTERscreen: A randomised controlled trial of patient SMS messaging in general practice to increase participation in the National Bowel Cancer Screening Program
column2: Targeted Call for Research"^"Most people invited to take part in free screening for bowel cancer do not participate. We will test whether a personalised SMS from the doctor
column3: to their patients phone
column4: will people completing and returning the home test kit sent. The SMS will contain a message from the person's doctor recommending they do it
column5: a video testimonial from someone affected by bowel cancer
column6: a link to the website of the screening program for more information
column7: and an animation of how to complete the home test kit."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014837^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014837"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"A breakthrough approach to define screening gaps in priority groups to target screening
column2: Targeted Call for Research"^"Improving breast screening participation requires accurate data of screening rates including within priority groups such as Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander women
column3: women from diverse cultural and language backgrounds and with different levels of educational attainment and income. Linkage between Census and NSW screening records can provide best evidence of screening rates overall
column4: within priority groups
column5: and following the impact of COVID and previous attempts to improve screening."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014908^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014908"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Embedding community driven models to increase cervical screening via HPV self-collection to improve cervical cancer outcomes for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people
column2: Targeted Call for Research"^"Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people face an unfair burden of cervical cancer. A new screening option lets people take their own sample; this may make screening easier. Working with communities and health services dedicated to Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander health needs we will co-design ways services can use self-collection and other strategies that best suit them and their communities. This work will engage more people to participate in screening in a culturally safe environment."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014964^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014964"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"MAIL
column2: GP
column3: and SCALE: Mobilising nAtIonaL bowel cancer screeninG Program participation through combining individual
column4: health ServiCe
column5: and populAtion Level intervEntions
column6: Targeted Call for Research"^"We aim to better understand how Australians are screening for bowel cancer and design a new method for GPs to advocate for the National Bowel Cancer Screening Program
column7: especially for people who screen outside the program but should not and those who have never or forgotten to screen. This project will take new and existing information on ways in which we can improve screening for bowel cancer and assess how they could be combined most effectively to prevent the greatest number of deaths."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015178^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015178"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"It’s a gamechanger” – using HPV self-collection to improve equity and participation in Australia's National Cervical Screening Program
column2: Targeted Call for Research"^"Integrating self-collection into Australia’s National Cervical Screening Program has game-changing potential to increase participation. We know that healthcare providers need more support to offer this option
column3: and women need information to support decision-making. Our project will enable innovative solutions to support providers
column4: women
column5: and the scale-up of self-collection
column6: and create an enabling environment for the consideration of models of care to increase access and equity."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015215^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015215"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Overcoming Inequity: Increasing Cervical Screening Participation for People with Intellectual Disability (CIRCE)
column2: Targeted Call for Research"^"People with intellectual disability (PWID) are under-screened for cervical cancer in Australia. Through a qualitative process
column3: this project seeks to identify facilitators and barriers to screening. A cluster randomised controlled trial will be undertaken to test the effectiveness of a co-designed
column4: co-produced suite of resources designed to support informed decision making and increase access and uptake of screening in the National Cervical Screening Program for PWID."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015286^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015286"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"BreastScreenPlus: A novel intervention targeting obesity-related barriers to mammographic screening
column2: Targeted Call for Research"^"Eight breast cancer deaths are prevented for every 1
column3: 000 women aged 50-74 years who undergo biennial mammographic screening. However
column4: despite the demonstrated benefits of (free) screening
column5: many women fail to return for screening when next due. This project will evaluate a novel intervention nested within BreastScreen WA to improve the screening experience for both obese women and service delivery staff and thereby
column6: increase rescreening participation in women with obesity."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015290^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015290"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"A preference-informed model to improve access and equity in bowel screening for Australia’s First Nations people through home care services
column2: Targeted Call for Research"^"Bowel cancer is the third-most common cancer affecting Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Australians. Participation in the National Bowel Cancer Screening Program by Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people is lower than for non-Indigenous Australians. This project aims to increase participation among the Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Home Care Clients by co-developing and implementing a bowel cancer screening program that is informed by their preferences and values."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007402^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007402"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Identifying the predictors and consequences of disparities in the uptake of HIV prevention and treatment programs in Australia: a national data linkage study
column2: Partnership Projects"^"We will create a national e-cohort of people with HIV
column3: linking HIV diagnoses from 1997-2025 with nine other national datasets. This comprehensive dataset will enable us to achieve our aims of tracking and analysing: missed clinical opportunities for HIV testing
column4: PrEP uptake and usage
column5: HIV treatment uptake and adherence
column6: and HIV-related morbidity and mortality. Outcomes will be used by Partner Organisations to develop tailored HIV programs
column7: to achieve elimination of HIV transmission in Australia."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2013921^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2013921"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"A national program to scale-up point-of-care hepatitis C testing and treatment
column2: Partnership Projects"^"Hepatitis C testing and treatment has declined in Australia
column3: slowing elimination progress. Our team evaluated a new point-of-care test for detection of active hepatitis C infection in one hour
column4: enabling same-visit diagnosis and treatment. This test is now approved in Australia and has changed how testing and treatment can be delivered. This Partnership Project will evaluate a national program funded by the Australian government to scale-up point-of-care hepatitis C testing in Australia."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014633^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014633"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"A non-surgical alternative to hysterectomy for the treatment of endometrial cancer
column2: Partnership Projects"^"This project aims to develop a personalised treatment decision tool used to counsel endometrial cancer patients about their surgical and non-surgical (hormonal) treatment options. It will take into account key attributes of importance such as fertility preservation
column3: risk of surgical morbidity
column4: risk of relapse
column5: genetic factors
column6: quality of life
column7: patient values and treatment preferences. This work is of critical importance for patients with early onset endometrial cancer
column8: and for frail patients."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014684^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014684"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Novel strategies to improve protection for pregnant women and medically at risk children from influenza and COVID-19
column2: Partnership Projects"^"Pregnant women and children with chronic medical conditions are at increased risk of hospitalisation
column3: intensive care admission and death from influenza and COVID-19 infections. However
column4: there appears to be a high level of vaccine hesitancy among women of reproductive age. We will develop “nudge” interventions to improve influenza and COVID vaccine uptake among pregnant women and medically at risk children and test the effectiveness of the interventions using randomised controlled trials."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014821^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014821"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Optimising functional and social independence and safety of older people living with dementia in care homes: Implementation research
column2: Partnership Projects"^"This program builds on true collaboration with the project partner organisations and decades of the research team's track records in promoting evidence informed best practice in dementia care
column3: leveraging their extensive network of partners in research and the aged-care industry. The outcomes will inform researchers
column4: service providers and policymakers working in the aged care sector about implementation of person centred
column5: reablement approaches to dementia care
column6: nationally and internationally."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015197^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015197"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"An integrated platform for the early diagnosis and treatment of biotoxin-related illnesses in Australia like Chronic Inflammatory Response Syndrome
column2: Targeted Call for Research"^"While many studies now suggest that living in dampness and mould can adversely affect the immune system in some people
column3: few studies define tests that doctors could use to diagnose and treat affected individuals. This research project will study both affected individuals and healthy controls
column4: examining their blood
column5: urine
column6: and sweat along with other tests such as brain scans and environmental testing in their homes
column7: in order to identify appropriate diagnostic tests that doctors can use."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014696^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014696"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"The Indigenous Australian HPV Cohort Study 2; continuation 5 to 10 years
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies"^"Continuing a large
column3: representative Indigenous adult cohort through which to track oral HPV infection
column4: monitor early throat cancer and estimate cost-effectiveness of extensive HPV vaccination coverage in culturally safe ways is essential to yield critical information to include in the management armamentarium of health and wellbeing recommendations for Australia’s First Peoples."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014723^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014723"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"INTErGenerational intervention to Reduce fraIlTY trial (INTEGRITY).
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies"^"The recent ABC TV show ‘Old People’s Home For Four Year Olds’ shows on-screen benefits of bringing together older adults and pre-schoolers. This has enormous potential to benefit our ageing society and similar programs are becoming popular. but a TV show is not the same as everyday life. We now need to establish how these benefits work in a realistic everyday setting. We will test this using a community-based clinical trial: the INTErGenerational Intervention to Reduce fraIlTY trial (INTEGRITY)."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014729^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014729"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Making Inroads: RCT of a web-based early intervention to interrupt the vicious cycle of co-occurring anxiety and hazardous alcohol use among young adults
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies"^"Anxiety and alcohol disorders often co-occur
column3: fueling each other in a self-perpetuating cycle. Early intervention is crucial to engage people with effective management strategies when problematic symptoms first emerge
column4: and before anxiety and alcohol use disorders become entrenched. This study will evaluate the Inroads program
column5: an online early intervention to empower young adults
column6: enhance coping skills
column7: and interrupt the vicious cycle between anxiety and hazardous alcohol use."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014740^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014740"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Duration of Cardiac Antimicrobial Prophylaxis Outcomes Study (CALIPSO): multicentre
column2: adaptive
column3: double-blind
column4: three-arm
column5: placebo-controlled
column6: non-inferiority trial examining antimicrobial prophylaxis duration in cardiac surgery
column7: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies"^"Infections following surgery lead to significant patient suffering and healthcare costs. The administration of antibiotics at the time of surgery is an important strategy to prevent infections. In patients undergoing heart surgery we do not know whether there is an additional benefit to giving longer courses of antibiotics following surgery to help prevent infections or if this will lead to patient harm
column8: such as drug-resistant infections. This project will answer these important questions."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014750^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014750"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"PRECeDe: Prevention of neonatal Respiratory morbidity with antenatal corticosteroids prior to Elective Caesarean section in women with Diabetes: A Randomised trial
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies"^"This research trial will determine whether giving corticosteroid injections to pregnant women with diabetes before elective Caesarean section between 35+0 and 39+6 weeks reduces the rate of breathing problems in their babies. We will study the short-term benefits and side effects in the mothers and babies
column3: and also determine whether giving corticosteroid injections is good value for money."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014763^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014763"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Epigenetic Protection Predicts Risk Diabetic Nephropathy (EPICENTRE)
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies"^"Diabetes affects over 1 million Australians and disproportionately affects Indigenous Australians. We have established an international EPICENTRE consortium now seek to explore the potential role of epigenetic modifications to explain the development of diabetic renal disease. Over the last decade we have developed contemporary genomic technologies and new approaches that specifically characterise epigenetic modifications using overt renal disease as the primary outcome."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014800^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014800"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Personalised Selection of Medication for Newly Diagnosed Adult Epilepsy – the PERSONAL Trial
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies"^"We have trained a machine learning prediction model that can assist neurologists to select the most effective initial antiseizure medication for individual patients with newly diagnosed epilepsy. We propose a randomised controlled trial (PERSONAL) to evaluate whether incorporating the machine learning model in initial drug selection can render more patients seizure-free compared to usual care. A total of 234 patients will be recruited from 14 epilepsy centres across all six states of Australia."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014833^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014833"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"A primary care provider intervention to improve early child neurodevelopment in Urban Aboriginal children
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies"^"Despite a high level of developmental issues in Aboriginal babies
column3: there has been no primary health care delivered early child development program starting in the first 4 weeks of life. We will address Aboriginal child’s development by improving primary health care’s ability to deliver child development services. We will do this by seeing if the CCD program commenced in the first 4-weeks of life will improves a child’s developmental needs in the first year of life."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014841^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014841"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"The LifeTrack Project: Population-based longitudinal cohort study to understand suicidal transitions
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies"^"We don't understand why some people who think about suicide go on to make a suicide attempt
column3: while others recover. There have been very few studies following individuals at risk of suicide over an extended time period. We will test a group of people with suicidal thoughts for three years to work out whether there are certain types of people who are more resistant to suicide attempt. We will use the information from the study to identify new ways to reduce suicide risk in the population."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014868^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014868"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"The FLIRT-TB study: A fluoroquinolone-based regimen to treat the commonest form of drug-resistant tuberculosis
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies"^"Tuberculosis (TB) is an infectious respiratory disease affecting 10 million people each year worldwide. Resistance to isoniazid
column3: one of the most important first-line antibiotics used to treat TB
column4: leads to increased mortality and more advanced drug resistance. We will undertake the first clinical trial to evaluate the effectiveness of new-generation fluoroquinolones antibiotics in treating isoniazid-resistant TB. This trial will be conducted in Australia
column5: Vietnam and Canada."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014896^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014896"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Are calcium channel blockers associated with breast cancer? Assessing the impact of long-term use in large longitudinal cohorts
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies"^"Breast cancer is the commonest cancer in women. Calcium channel blockers (CCBs) are frequently used worldwide to treat high blood pressure. A link between use of CCBs and breast cancer has been proposed with mixed findings in North American
column3: European and Asian women. No data exist for Australian women or across populations. Since 1 in 8 Australian women will be diagnosed with breast cancer by age 85 years
column4: it is important to determine whether this risk is increased by the use of CCBs."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014899^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014899"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Perinatal depression and antidepressants treatment: wave 7 follow up of the MPEWS longitudinal cohort study
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies"^"When examining the longer term outcomes from pregnancy treatment with antidepressants on maternal depression and on child developmental outcomes
column3: randomized controlled trials for antidepressants are not ethically possible and as such cohort data are required. Currently there remains uncertainty about antidepressant treatment in pregnancy for clinicians and women. We will address this gap in cohort studies through undertaking a follow up wave of a prospective longitudinal pregnancy cohort study."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014900^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014900"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"SNAP-PY: Staphylococcus aureus Network Adaptive Platform trial for Paediatrics and Youth
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies"^"Staphylococcus aureus is the most common cause of bloodstream infections resulting in hospital admission for children. The best antibiotic treatments for children are not known. The Staph aureus Network Adaptive Platform trial for Paediatrics and Youth (SNAP-PY) will find out the best antibiotic treatments for children and adolescents. This will optimise antibiotic treatment for children with Staph aureus bloodstream infections and reduce premature deaths."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014930^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014930"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Translatable Evidence To Improve Lung Health Outcomes In First Nations People – A Cohort Study From Birth to 6 Years
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies"^"Good lung health as an adult depends on how healthy we are as children. Good lung health predicts future heart health and how long we live. First Nations children have unacceptably high rates of lung disease which means poorer adult health. There are certain exposures or events in childhood that can be protective or damaging to our lungs. This research will look at a range of these exposures and events and study them in detail to discover ways to help improve the health of FirstN People."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014932^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014932"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Can mass drug administration reduce the incidence of adverse perinatal outcomes and other health consequences of endemic sexually transmitted infections? A community effectiveness trial
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies"^"Sexual and reproductive health is an urgent global public health priority in Fiji and the Pacific region
column3: where curable sexually transmitted infections (STIs) are endemic. This world first trial will use mass drug administration with azithromycin to reduce the prevalence of chlamydia and gonorrhoeae in a population of >180
column4: 000 people in Fiji and will be the first to measure the effect of MDA on serious complications of STIs in the general population."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014936^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014936"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"ICON9: A phase 3 randomised trial of cediranib and olaparib maintenance in patients with relapsed platinum sensitive ovarian cancer
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies"^"In Australia ovarian cancer is the most common cause of gynaecological cancer death. Despite surgery and chemotherapy 80% of affected women have cancer relapse which is ultimately fatal. This international randomised clinical trial examines if combining 2 targeted therapies
column3: cediranib and olaparib tablets taken after finishing chemotherapy
column4: will help women live longer without cancer progression. The trial will complete recruitment in 2022 and this funding will ensure patient follow-up continues"^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014937^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014937"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Resuscitation in Paediatric Septic Shock using Mega-Dose Vitamin C and Hydrocortisone - A Randomised Controlled Multicentre Trial (RESPOND study)
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies"^"Globally
column3: a child dies from sepsis every 10 seconds; in Australia
column4: a child dies every week. Many surviving children experience long term adverse outcomes. Australian states are implementing mandates for sepsis treatment. Yet
column5: the evidence for sepsis treatment other than antibiotics is limited. We will perform an international study for children with sepsis which will test the use of mega-dose vitamin C and steroids - a promising treatment that has already shown some benefit in adults."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014952^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014952"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Understanding intergenerational change in the health and well-being of older adults and its effects: The Sydney Memory and Ageing Study 2.
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies"^"Has there been a generational change in health of older Australians? We aim to compare the cognitive
column3: physical
column4: psychological and social health of current older Australians and those from 17 years ago. Each generation undergoes different experiences compared to previous ones; these can effect health. We will repeat and expand (using new technology) on our 2005+ survey of 1037 70-90 year olds to answer this question. Answers will shed light on protective factors and inform health planning."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014954^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014954"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"AAT-APP Trial: A RCT of alcohol approach-avoidance training to reduce heavy drinking in people with alcohol use disorders
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies"^"When people undergoing alcohol treatment are given computerised training to avoid alcohol images
column3: and approach positive images instead
column4: it reduces their likelihood of relapsing. We have developed and tested the world’s first smartphone app that delivers a personalised version of this “approach/avoidance training” (“AAT-App”). We now aim to determine how effective AAT-App is at reducing alcohol use and craving in a large sample of people with alcohol dependence who are not receiving treatment."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014960^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014960"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"SODA-BIC: Sodium Bicarbonate For Decompensated Metabolic Acidosis in the Intensive Care Unit
column2: A Multicentre
column3: Randomised
column4: Double-Blind Clinical Trial
column5: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies"^"Metabolic acidosis is a term that means that the blood is acidic. Patients with this condition are typically very ill and may die. No specific therapy exists
column6: but sodium bicarbonate (a cheap and widely available drug) may improve the condition of these patients. We will randomly (like tossing a coin) treat severe patients with either sodium bicarbonate or inactive fluid given into a vein by continuous drip. We will compare the mortality rate and the use of haemodialysis within the first 30 days."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014980^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014980"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"A randomised controlled trial of cannabidiol (CBD) in the treatment of cannabis dependence
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies"^"Cannabis use is increasing in Australia
column3: yet there are few effective treatments for cannabis dependence. This study will evaluate cannabidiol (CBD) combined with counselling to reduce illicit cannabis use and improve health and social outcomes
column4: compared to placebo in a randomised trial with 250 participants across services in NSW and Victoria. Aboriginal people comprise 20% of people in treatment for cannabis
column5: and we will purposively examine their outcomes and experiences in the study."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015020^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015020"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Magnetic Resonance imaging outcomes in the Colchicine After Stroke to Prevent Event Recurrence (MR-CASPER) trial
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies"^"MR-CASPER is a multi-centre
column3: prospective
column4: randomised
column5: double-blind trial of the anti-inflammatory agent colchicine to prevent recurrent stroke and rapid progression of atherosclerotic disease. The trial uses novel
column6: serial Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) of the brain and cerebral blood vessels to measure outcomes alongside cognitive
column7: mood and quality of life assessments. MR-CASPER will give crucial mechanistic insights into the effects of colchicine on brain and blood vessel inflammation."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015060^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015060"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Childhood febrile convulsions - do treatment patterns determine the risk of early recurrence?
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies"^"A febrile convulsion in a young child is incredibly stressful. Parents often think their child is dying. Currently
column3: no specific treatment is offered to parents when their child is discharged from hospital. Our research
column4: to be conducted across 25 hospitals
column5: will compare the current "wait and see" approach to treatment recommendations for regular doses of paracetamol or ibuprofen to control fevers. We hope to test if the new treatment reduces the risk of more seizures occurring in the same illness"^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015100^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015100"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Accelerating clot lysis in ischemic stroke with dornase alfa in an Umbrella Bayesian Optimised Phase 2 trial
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies"^"Stroke remains a major cause of disability. Clot-dissolving medicines targeting fibrin can be rapidly delivered at most Australian hospitals. DNA extruded by white blood cells is another key structural component of clot. Dornase
column3: an approved medicine for other diseases
column4: dissolves DNA and we showed accelerated clot dissolving when combined with standard treatment. Our trial will test whether dornase can accelerate restoration of blood flow to improve outcomes in up to 300 patients with stroke."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015133^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015133"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Avatar-mediated therapy for hallucinations: superiority trial (AMETHYST)
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies"^"Hearing hostile and critical voices is a highly distressing experience that characterises psychosis. Current treatments have limited impact
column3: and more potent therapies are urgently needed. A promising new approach uses virtual reality technology to recreate the voices the person hears as digital avatars
column4: used in therapy sessions to help overcome this experience. This clinical trial will determine whether this therapy offers a more powerful therapeutic option than current recommended treatment."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015140^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015140"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"A Surfactant Treatment Method for Modern Neonatal Care: SURFactant by SUPraglottic Airway (The SURFSUP RCT)
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies"^"This trial will assess a new method of giving surfactant treatment into the lungs of premature babies with breathing difficulties. 'Supraglottic airway' are soft plastic devices that are easier to insert and more comfortable than current methods
column3: which are challenging to learn and not possible for some neonatal units. We will test the effectiveness of supraglottic airway surfactant treatment
column4: which will allow all babies who need surfactant to receive it in their birth hospital without delay."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015146^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015146"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"EFFECT OF A VAPORISED NICOTINE PRODUCT vs VARENICLINE ON SMOKING CESSATION FOR LOW-SOCIOECONOMIC STATUS SMOKERS: A RANDOMISED TRIAL
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies"^"Smoking cessation aids can support long-term smoking cessation
column3: but quit rates from current approaches remain low. VNPs are one such approach that has shown some promise for cessation
column4: but government and regulatory bodies have called for more trial evidence. Newer generation pod VNPs have not been evaluated in a clinical trial despite their popularity and wide use globally. Trial findings will have immediate practical applications and provide much needed evidence on a new alternative quit aid."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015147^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015147"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"ORVAC Stage 2 - Optimising Rotavirus Vaccine in Aboriginal Children: a double-blind
column2: randomised
column3: placebo-controlled
column4: adaptive clinical trial of a third scheduled dose of oral rotavirus vaccine for Australian Aboriginal children.
column5: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies"^"Rotavirus can cause such bad diarrhoea in children that they need to be hospitalised. Aboriginal children in remote and rural parts of Australia are up to 20 times more likely to need hospitalisation with rotavirus than non-Indigenous children. There is a vaccine for rotavirus. Optimising Rotavirus Vaccination in Aboriginal Children (ORVAC) will test whether giving Aboriginal children aged 6-11 months an extra (booster) dose of rotavirus vaccine will give them better protection from rotavirus."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015173^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015173"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"NUDG-ED: Trial of behavioural ‘nudging’ interventions to reduce unnecessary care for low back pain in the Emergency Department
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies"^"In 2018 over 120 000 people went to an emergency department in Australia because of low back pain. Most had 'simple' low back pain
column3: where medical care such as diagnostic imaging (x-Ray
column4: CT
column5: MRI) and strong opioid medicines offer little benefit. Yet 3 in every 4 patients still received this kind of care. Unnecessary care can harm patients and diverts substantial resources from where they are most needed. This project tests a new way to reduce unnecessary care in Australian hospitals."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015177^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015177"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving health outcomes in people with a dual diagnosis released from prison: a multi-jurisdictional
column2: prospective cohort study
column3: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies"^"People released from prison have poor health and die at a rate much higher than the general community. Among this already vulnerable group
column4: people with co-occurring mental health and substance use problems (‘dual diagnosis’) are particularly at risk. This study will examine health and health service outcomes for 4
column5: 232 adults released from prisons in QLD
column6: WA
column7: NSW and VIC
column8: and followed for more than 9 years through data linkage. The findings will inform improvements to throughcare nationally."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015203^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015203"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Maternal and early life origins of adolescent menstrual disorders and pelvic pain
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies"^"Menstrual disorders – irregular
column3: heavy
column4: or painful periods – and pelvic pain are common among adolescent girls and disrupt life activities. Not enough is known about the maternal and early life factors linked with these conditions. This study addresses evidence gaps with new data on menstruation in adolescence
column5: combined with previous data available from these girls and their mothers. The new knowledge on the development of these conditions will inform and guide their prevention and management."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015208^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015208"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"‘The Next Generation Aboriginal Youth Cohort Study’: Co-designing a strengths-based study to identify evidence-based
column2: culturally strong
column3: implementable strategies to improve youth health outcomes
column4: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies"^"The project aims to undertake two waves of follow-up of young Aboriginal people from the 'Next Generation Youth Wellbeing study' in partnership with young people
column5: their families and Aboriginal Community organisations. The study will examine changes in key health outcomes (social and emotional wellbeing
column6: cardiovascular risk factors and avoidable injury) and factors that impact on those outcomes such as connection to culture
column7: health behaviours and social challenges."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015248^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015248"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Testing an implementable strategy to improve infant skin barrier to prevent asthma and preserve lung function: a 4-year follow-up of the existing PEBBLES RCT
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies"^"We will test if improving the infant skin barrier by using daily regular skincare treatment can reduce early life asthma and lung function deficits. This trial may change infant skincare practices and reduce the amount of respiratory disease in our community. This is a follow-on study of our large NHMRC funded trial
column3: testing if this intervention can improve skin barrier
column4: and reduce the incidence of allergic sensitisation and food allergy."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015584^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015584"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Centre for Safe Air
column2: Centres of Research Excellence"^"Outdoor air hazards like allergens
column3: traffic emissions
column4: and smoke cause a substantial health burden by contributing to diseases of the lungs
column5: heart and brain. Some threats
column6: like bushfire smoke
column7: are increasing but research and policy responses remain fragmented across health and environmental fields. We will bring together experts
column8: policymakers
column10: innovative solutions for protecting community health in the face of existing and escalating airborne threats."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015587^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015587"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Violence Perpetration: Profiling
column2: Prediction and Prevention
column3: Centres of Research Excellence"^"Violence is a major public health issue. It is a major cause of death
column4: suffering and economic loss worldwide. The focus of this CRE is to better understand violence perpetration
column5: and to facilitate improvements in its prediction and prevention. Eleven projects will observe individual factors such as early life experiences
column6: cognition and medication use
column7: and consider broader issues such as sentencing practices in court and how to optimize the collection and use of large violence-related data."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015611^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015611"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"CRE for STrengthening Health Systems in Remote Australia (CRESTRA)
column2: Centres of Research Excellence"^"The Centre of Research Excellence for Strengthening Health Systems in Remote Australia brings together Australia’s leading remote health researchers and remote primary care services across four states to carry out a program of research that will ensure: (1) stable and competent staffing; (2) fair funding; and (3) well-coordinated health services
column3: thereby improving access to high quality health services in remote areas
column4: reducing hospitalisations and improving health outcomes at a lesser cost."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015613^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015613"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"CRE for Interstitial Lung Disease - towards Individualised Care
column2: Centres of Research Excellence"^"The Centre for Research Excellence in Interstitial Lung Disease (ILD) – towards Individualised Care (CRE-ILD) aims to transform and extend the lives of people with ILD
column3: through effective
column4: personalised approaches to identify and manage ILD. Building on our successful CRE for pulmonary fibrosis
column5: exceptional national platforms and multidisciplinary expert team
column6: CRE-ILD will broaden our focus to all ILD
column7: in a personalised approach specifically addressing our patients’ identified research priorities."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015615^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015615"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Australia and New Zealand Musculoskeletal (ANZMUSC) Clinical Trials Network
column2: Centres of Research Excellence"^"The Australia and New Zealand Musculoskeletal (ANZMUSC) Clinical Trial Network was established in 2015 to address the immense burden of musculoskeletal conditions. With the aid of NHMRC-CRE investment (2018-22) we have already driven improvements in care. Our new CRE will significantly extend our reach
column3: scope
column4: depth and impact. Three new foci will be to bridge the bench to bedside gap
column5: state-of-the-art trials of complex interventions
column6: embedded in usual care
column7: and 3) globalisation of our work."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015622^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015622"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Science Translation for e-Psychological Perinatal Supports (STePPS CRE)
column2: Centres of Research Excellence"^"Over 300
column3: 000 women give birth in Australia each year and 20% experience clinical depression
column4: often with severe anxiety
column5: either in pregnancy or the first postnatal year. By bringing together cutting edge Australian and international research in perinatal mental health
column6: the goal is to reduce the burden of mental health difficulties on families and future generations. This CRE will produce better Knowledge
column7: better Interventions and e-mental health treatments
column8: Improved access and treatment uptake."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015705^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015705"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"A Centre of Research Excellence to Accelerate Stroke Trial Innovation and Translation
column2: Centres of Research Excellence"^"Stroke remains a serious medical problem affecting tens of thousands of Australians each year. This CRE application will deliver better healthcare for those with stroke
column3: by co-designing new stroke trials with consumers
column4: and using new technology to deliver stroke interventions in rural and remote Australia. Our 'whole of system" approach will speed up translation of new treatments and we will build a new generation of clinician researchers to increase future stroke research capacity."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015724^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015724"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Towards eradicating food allergy: from population to precision prevention
column2: early intervention and management
column3: Centres of Research Excellence"^"Australia has the world’s highest rate of food allergy. We have made significant progress understanding strategies to prevent food allergy and are testing these in large clinical trials. We now aim to understand who will benefit from these strategies
column4: to reduce the number of children developing allergies
column5: how best to treat and manage allergy to improve the lives of those living with food allergy
column6: and to rapidly transfer research findings into public health policy and clinical practice changes."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015727^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015727"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Translational Centre for Speech Disorders
column2: Centres of Research Excellence"^"One in 5 children have a speech or language disorder at school entry
column3: with lifelong deficits in psychosocial
column4: academic and employment outcomes. Current speech pathology management is severely limited because it focuses on symptoms and ignores critical growing evidence on underlying genetic and neural aetiologies. The vision of our CRE is to transform speech pathology
column5: by identifying
column6: understanding and targeting the underlying aetiology that results in the symptomatology."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015739^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015739"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Centre for Research Excellence in Cervical Cancer Control (C4)
column2: Centres of Research Excellence"^"This proposal will continue the work of our successful Centre of Research Excellence in Cervical Cancer Control - “C4”. To realise the elimination goal of cervical cancer
column3: we will tackle the enormous inequities in access to cervical cancer control interventions
column4: through implementation activities focused on achieving high and equitable participation in HPV vaccination
column5: cervical screening
column6: triage and treatment
column7: including developing and evaluating new pathways for HPV self-collection for screening."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015747^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015747"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"The Centre of Research Excellence in Bipolar Disorder (CORE-BD)
column2: Centres of Research Excellence"^"Bipolar disorder (BD) is a pervasive and debilitating disorder. The Centre of Research Excellence in Bipolar Disorders (CORE-BD) presents a unique opportunity for Australia to position itself as an international leader in BD research
column3: spanning early detection and intervention
column4: through to helping those with chronic BD. By growing workforce capacity
column5: we will ensure research findings are implemented into practice in order to help reduce the burden experienced by those impacted by BD."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015820^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015820"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Centre of Research Excellence in Urban Indigenous Health
column2: Centres of Research Excellence"^"Unmet health needs for urban Indigenous Australians are well documented
column3: alongside a persistent gap in health research conducted with this population. Australia’s first Centre of Research Excellence in Urban Indigenous Health will drive innovative research aimed at achieving excellence in health care delivery. Our CRE will harness existing partnerships and infrastructure to develop the next generation of health researchers to drive Australia's first urban Indigenous health research agenda."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015821^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015821"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Frailty ADD: Improving Hospital Outcomes for Frail Patients Across Different Disciplines
column2: Centres of Research Excellence"^"Frail patients are often harmed in hospitals. This CRE will improve hospital outcomes for frail patients by helping healthcare systems understand the impact of frailty on outcomes and costs
column3: developing clinical practice guidelines for frailty informed care across multiple disciplines
column4: developing a core outcome set for frail patients
column5: and upskilling the next generation of researchers and clinicians to continue the legacy of this CRE."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015843^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015843"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"DRIVE CP: Directing Research In Very Early Cerebral Palsy
column2: Centres of Research Excellence"^"Cerebral Palsy (CP) is common (1 in 700) and the cost is immense (0.14% GDP). The rate has fallen by 30% meaning more is possible. Our CRE is co-designed with consumers to directly address the priorities set by consumers in our National CP strategy. Together we will diagnose CP early through a national screening program
column3: then develop and transmit new early interventions
column4: that reduce severity and improve independence. We will use artificial intelligence to automate screening for diagnosis."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015501^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015501"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Pathway Of Low Anterior Resection syndrome relief after Surgery (POLARiS) trial
column2: International Collaborations"^"Disease-free survival is usually regarded as the most important consideration after rectal cancer surgery. As survival outcomes have improved
column3: there is increasing focus on ‘survivorship’ and QoL. One important determinant of QoL is post-operative bowel function which can be deleteriously impacted by surgery. Optimal management of bowel dysfunction following surgery (LARS) remains unclear. This trial will compare 3 interventions for LARS
column4: and assess their influence on QoL and cost-effectiveness."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015726^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015726"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"The clinical and cost-effectiveness of lumbar fusion surgery for patients with persistent
column2: severe low back pain: FusiOn veRsus bEst coNServative Care (the FORENSIC trial)
column3: International Collaborations"^"Lumbar fusion is an operation in which bones in the spine (vertebrae) are fixed together to try to help patients who have persistent low back pain that is thought to be related to specific spine changes seen on scans. We do not know whether this type of surgery for these patients is better than offering further high quality non-surgical care. We will conduct a large trial to test whether lumbar fusion surgery is better for patients and the healthcare system than high quality non-surgical care."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017548^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017548"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Youth-GEMs: Gene Environment interactions in Mental health trajectories of Youth
column2: International Collaborations"^"Mental disorders in children and adolescents have a large impact on the individuals
column3: their families and society. This project aims to improve prediction of mental health trajectories by including biological markers as that will facilitate targeted intervention. We will make use of already collected data in various cohorts in the general population
column4: but will also collect longitudinal data in at risk clinical populations
column5: presenting to emergency departments."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017566^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017566"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Clinical validation of Artificial Intelligence for providing a personalized motor clinical profile assessment and rehabilitation of upper limb in children with unilateral Cerebral Palsy
column2: International Collaborations"^"Cerebral Palsy is the most common physical disability in childhood (1 in 700) and Hemiplegia is the most common form (40%). Children with hemiplegia have impairments to hand function and mobility that impact self care
column3: participation in school and leisure and long term vocational aspirations. Accurate diagnosis is important for accessing tailored interventions
column4: individualised rehabilitation and prognosis for education
column5: employment and independent living."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017666^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017666"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"PREFERABLE-II - Personalised Exercise-Oncology for improvement of supportive care: a super umbrella trial to demonstrate the (cost)effectiveness of live-remote exercise in cancer survivors
column2: International Collaborations"^"Cancer and its treatment can lead to sustained deleterious side effects. Exercise can improve long-term cancer side effects and quality of life; yet
column3: access to high-quality exercise support is not routinely available. PREFERABLE-II evaluates the (cost)-effectiveness of a convenient
column4: live-remote exercise intervention that targets common cancer-related side effects. The project aims to improve the accessibility of best-practice exercise to all cancer survivors and improve supportive cancer care."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017786^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017786"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improvement of school indoor air quality and children's health
column2: International Collaborations"^"This Australian project will conduct short-term controlled trials to assess the effect of change in indoor air quality in primary schools on the health and cognitive outcomes of children in Melbourne. Together with InChildHealth supported by H2020
column3: this project will fill information gaps for the indoor air quality legal framework
column4: providing guidelines and recommendations that support health promotion and disease prevention for children in the schools."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017837^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017837"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Identification of chemical and biological determinants
column2: their sources
column3: and strategies to promote healthier homes in Europe (INQUIRE)
column4: International Collaborations"^"While Australians are estimated to spend roughly 90% of their time indoors
column5: we understand little about the air pollutants that may be present in homes. As part of a broader European study
column6: this project aims to assess air and dust samples from Australian homes
column7: along with urine samples from residents
column8: to characterise indoor air pollutants
column10: and determine impacts on health. This knowledge can be used to guide policy and industry towards approaches to improve indoor air quality."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018124^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018124"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Risk and Resilience in Developmental Diversity and Mental Health
column2: International Collaborations"^"Mental health problems affect a staggering 20% of the Australian population and cost our government $11 billion dollars in 2019-2020. Within any 12 month period
column3: over half a million Australian children experience a mental disorder and prevalence is highest for those with pre-existing neurodevelopmental disorders. Current management is failing as it focuses entirely on mental health risk. Our pioneering work will move the field to understand and promote resilience in EU and Australian contexts."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018165^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018165"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"PSYCH-STRATA - A Stratified Treatment Algorithm in Psychiatry: A program on stratified pharmacogenomics in severe mental illness
column2: International Collaborations"^"About 30% of people suffering from mental illnesses such as schizophrenia
column3: bipolar disorder
column4: and major depression don't benefit from treatment with standard medicines and have "treatment resistance" (TR). TR leads to great individual suffering and often to a sense of "failure". The vision of PsychSTRATA is to pave the way for a shift from the current step-wise trial-and-error paradigm of psychiatric therapies towards targeted early introduction of intensive treatments for people at risk of TR."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015018^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015018"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"TRANSMIT: A multifaceted knowledge TRANslation Strategy iMprovIng funcTion in children and youth with cerebral palsy
column2: Partnership Projects"^"One third of children with cerebral palsy (CP) will never walk
column3: and one quarter will never talk. These children receive ineffective treatments 43% of the time
column4: lowering their chance of employment. We will build a mobile health aide that filters effective intervention options for children with CP
column5: that overcomes the need to understand complex health information
column6: and that supports consumers to choose
column7: clinicians to provide
column8: and policymakers to reimburse effective treatments."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015440^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015440"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Promoting CHANGE (Community Health And Nutrition
column2: and Government Engagement): a Randomised Controlled Trial to accelerate healthy food retail in local government settings
column3: Partnership Projects"^"This grant will test if an intervention to support retail outlets in Local Government settings (e.g. community sports centres) to improve availability and promotion of healthy food and drink is effective and delivers good value for money. The study will provide evidence from a rigorous randomised controlled trial to support the creation of healthier food environments. Ultimately this will improve what people eat and help reduce the risk of diet-related diseases in an effective and sustained way."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015462^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015462"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"BUBs Quit study: Clinical Midwife Specialist to assist pregnant women to quit smoking using counselling and embedded technology
column2: Partnership Projects"^"This study will determine the effectiveness of the BUBs Quit smoking cessation intervention delivered by trained midwives compared to usual care in assisting pregnant women to quit during pregnancy and maintain abstinence at 6 months post-birth. We will explore factors affecting integration of the intervention into usual maternity care. We expect that the BUBs Quit intervention will reduce smoking rates among pregnant women compared to the comparison group by at least 8.5% and be cost effective."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015470^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015470"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Delivering a population-based intervention to reduce young driver crashes
column2: Partnership Projects"^"Road crashes are a leading cause of injury mortality and morbidity. As a consequence of advances in telematics technology
column3: there is an opportunity to deliver a unique prevention strategy that will influence a drivers’ risk taking and hence crash propensity. We propose a randomised controlled trial to assess the effects of personalised safety feedback and financial incentives
column4: delivered using a smartphone application
column5: on reducing motor vehicle crashes over the first 6-months of driving"^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015514^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015514"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"MenoPROMPT: a co-designed
column2: comprehensive
column3: evidence-based program to improve the care of women at and after menopause.
column4: Partnership Projects"^"Menopausal symptoms are frequently debilitating. Despite readily available
column5: safe therapy
column6: most severely symptomatic women are not receiving evidenced-based therapy. We will develop a simple menopause assessment and decision-making tool
column7: that will be integrated into general practitioner (GP) software
column8: so that key information is immediately accessible to GPs
column9: together with a pre-consultation women’s health self-assessment tool
column11: to ensure menopausal symptoms are not overlooked."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015532^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015532"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"The PeriWarm Trial: Transforming perioperative temperature management for better patient outcomes
column2: Partnership Projects"^"Perioperative hypothermia occurs when patients undergoing surgery lose body heat. As well as discomfort
column3: heat loss also causes other adverse health outcomes including wound infection
column4: increased blood loss
column5: longer hospital stays and increased costs. Although guidance to prevent perioperative hypothermia is available
column6: this guidance is not widely used. This project seeks to reduce perioperative hypothermia through assisting health care providers to use guidance and improve patient outcomes."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015544^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015544"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Smarter hospitals: Unlocking the promise of virtual models of care through infrastructure innovation in Australian healthcare facilities
column2: Partnership Projects"^"Virtual models of care can improve patient health outcomes and their healthcare experience
column3: at a reduced cost in comparison to face-to-face care. Significant evidence gaps remain about how to design healthcare facilities to integrate virtual care
column4: how to ensure equitable health outcomes when using virtual care
column5: and how to support workforce change management. Our program of work provides the evidence and solutions required by our Partner Organisations and health services nationally."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015744^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015744"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"RELEASE: REdressing Long-tErm Antidepressant uSE in general practice
column2: Partnership Projects"^"Our aim is to improve Australian health outcomes by decreasing unnecessary and potentially harmful long-term (&gt;12 months) prescribing of antidepressants in general practice. The outcomes of our research will include a validated antidepressant discontinuation model and proven implementation strategies
column3: including practical resources where currently there are none
column4: to foster sustainable improvement in primary mental health care
column5: including for urban and rural general practice."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015751^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015751"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Digitally Enhancing Youth Mental Health Services across Australia: cluster RCT of an Adaptive
column2: TaiLored
column3: and behAvioural Science-informed (ATLAS) Implementation Strategy
column4: Partnership Projects"^"The mental health system is overwhelmed and has catastrophically failed to meet the needs of those with mental-ill health. Despite the potential for digital technology to be a pillar of a modern
column5: sustainable
column6: and adaptive mental health system
column7: digital interventions have not been integrated into mental health services. This aim of this project is to address this global failure by integrating a fully-funded
column8: evidenced-based digital platform (MOST) in a large network of mental health services."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015773^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015773"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Strengthening Healthcare Systems with Patient Reported Outcome Measures (PROMs)
column2: Partnership Projects"^"The collection and use of Patient Reported Outcome Measures (PROMs) enhances two way communication between patients and clinicians
column3: resulting in improved outcomes and quality of life for patients. This research aims to understand what makes PROMs acceptable to clinicians and consumers
column4: when they should be collected
column5: and how PRO data can best be displayed for quality assurance and care. This will facilitate use of PROMs in healthcare
column6: driving change at an individual
column7: service and system level."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015783^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015783"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Optimising public health notification systems to achieve hepatitis C elimination in Australia
column2: Partnership Projects"^"Australia can eliminate hepatitis C as a public health threat by sustaining high rates of hepatitis C treatment. But Australia’s rates of hepatitis C treatment have stalled over recent years. All hepatitis C diagnoses are notified to health departments and this partnership project will implement and evaluate a series of strategies across all states and territories and identify the most effective ways of following up notifications to enhance rates of hepatitis C treatment and cure in Australia."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015784^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015784"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Bipolar Early intervention using New Digital technologies: a hybrid effectiveness-implementation trial of a multi-component model of evidence-based care
column2: Partnership Projects"^"Early intervention for young people with serious mood problems like Bipolar Disorder is largely unavailable in Australia. To address this
column3: we have developed an innovative model of care that combines three effective interventions (BLEND). In this project
column4: we will evaluate how effective the BLEND model is in improving young people’s quality of life
column5: compared with standard mental health care. We will also aim to understand whether the strategies used to implement BLEND are acceptable and feasible."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016268^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016268"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"RBR E3 ubiquitin ligases in health and disease
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Cells in the human body constantly process signals to react to changes in their environment. Errors in cellular signalling cause diseases like cancers and neurodegeneration. One key signalling molecule is the small protein ubiquitin. My program will develop tools to uncover how the processes involved in ubiquitin signalling occur normally and how they can cause disease. This provides new opportunities to understand basic biology
column3: discover and exploit new drug targets
column4: and develop novel medicines."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016274^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016274"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"More accurate disease assessment and improved clinical decision-making for patients with urothelial cancers
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Cancers of the bladder and similar tissues (“urothelial cancers”) can cause major health issues
column3: including shortened survival and significant loss of quality of life. Some patients can benefit from more aggressive treatment while others will not
column4: but we cannot yet tell who. We have developed a simple
column5: quick
column6: and easy method to look for urothelial cancer DNA in the blood. This project will test that method to see if it can help predict who might need more treatment and for whom it can be spared."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016277^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016277"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Leveraging big data to maximise the impact of pharmacists on medicines safety in aged care
column2: Investigator Grants"^"The recent Aged Care Royal Commission recommended urgent action to improve medicines use in aged care services. This project will tell us more about the effects of medicines when they are used by people receiving aged care services
column3: so that health professionals can make improvements. It will also establish a system to guide best practice for pharmacists who work in aged care settings and monitor for improvements in medicines use
column4: health and wellbeing among people who receive aged care services."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016279^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016279"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^""No Place to Grow Old": Advancing health care and management of Australia's ageing prisoners
column2: Investigator Grants"^"This research was designed in response to the rapid ageing of Australia’s prisoner population
column3: which is creating new
column4: unique and expensive challenges to criminal justice and public health. The research aims to generate important data regarding the health and functioning status of older prisoners. It also aims to inform better health and service provision upon release from prison
column5: where older prisoners are at particular risk of adverse outcomes."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016283^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016283"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Detailing epigenetic mechanisms in cancer evolution for improved patient outcomes
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Cancers are very difficult to cure because they can adapt to therapy
column3: become resistant and recur. The ability to evade treatment is linked to the diversity of cells in a cancer: the more keys a cancer has
column4: the more likely it is to unlock resistance and escape therapy. This research project will explore cell diversity and cancer adaptation in a devastating blood cancer
column5: revealing new treatments that can delay or prevent recurrence."^""^""^""^
