column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016286^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016286"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving access to non-pharmacological treatment in chronic respiratory disease
column2: Investigator Grants"^"For people with chronic lung disease
column3: pulmonary rehabilitation improves symptoms and function
column4: and helps reduce healthcare costs. Yet very few (less than 10%) people who would benefit from pulmonary rehabilitation have ever done a program. This work will explore new ways to deliver pulmonary rehabilitation
column5: including directly to people’s homes
column6: to make access to programs easier. If more people can access and thus benefit from pulmonary rehabilitation
column7: health system costs could be reduced."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016301^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016301"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Stemming the rising tide of youth mental health problems: prevention through social connection
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Mental health problems
column3: such as depression and anxiety
column4: are rising in recent cohorts of adolescents. This research aims to generate new knowledge about effective prevention for these problems. It will utilise large-scale longitudinal data
column5: include a world-first RCT and generate practical guidelines for the implementation of effective prevention within secondary school settings."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016308^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016308"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Structure-function relationships in drug transport and inhibition of membrane proteins
column2: Investigator Grants"^"This project will study how drugs interact with bacterial targets and drug transporters. This work is instrumental in antimicrobial drug development and will also potentially increase current drug potency and effectiveness."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016324^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016324"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving critically ill patient outcomes through randomised trials and registries in intensive care
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Around 50% of Australians will be admitted to an intensive care unit in their lifetime
column3: with more than 175
column4: 000 intensive care admissions each year. As a global leader in intensive care
column5: including founding binational infrastructure
column6: my research program using the gold standard of phase III multicentre
column7: randomised
column8: controlled trials and registries will continue to deliver improvements in clinical decision-making and outcomes for critically ill patients
column9: as well as significant healthcare savings."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016330^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016330"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Investigations into phage biology directed at therapies for antimicrobial resistant (AMR) infections
column2: Investigator Grants"^"The rise of drug-resistant superbugs is a global problem with a bleak outlook. A projected increase to 10 million human deaths per year here and around the world can only be addressed with new
column3: sustainable solutions. My vision applies computational and structural biology as well as biochemistry and microbiology to evaluate and optimize the properties of viruses called "phages" to either resolve infections directly or re-sensitize bacteria in infection sites to existing drugs in clinical use."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016334^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016334"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"The Microbiota-Growth Hormone Axis - From Metabolic Function to Liver Disease
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) is the most common liver disease. If left untreated
column3: it can progress to advanced scarring
column4: liver failure or cancer. Current therapies are limited and for many patients
column5: ineffective. This project will investigate the involvement of gut microbes in the development of NAFLD and whether their targeted modulation could provide new treatment options."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016338^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016338"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Genetic basis for skeletal muscle formation and regeneration in development and disease
column2: Investigator Grants"^"I am a biomedical scientist who focuses on understanding how skeletal muscle is made and maintained
column3: and how this process is perturbed in diseases of childhood such as muscular dystrophies. I study muscle formation and growth and the role of muscle stem cells during injury and disease
column4: collaborating widely with an international and national clinical networks and with industry. My main research tool is the zebrafish model
column5: where the processes I study can be dissected in living muscle tissue."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016346^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016346"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Right care
column2: first time: delivering technology-enabled mental health care to young people at scale
column3: Investigator Grants"^"Providing highly-personalised mental health care to young people
column4: as early as possible in an illness
column5: is a global priority. COVID-19 has been particularly harsh on the mental health of youth. This program (‘Right Care
column6: First Time') uses digital technologies
column7: new health planning tools
column8: early intervention services and socio-economic policies to drive local delivery. These approaches require detailed studies to test whether they can deliver better health and economic outcomes."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016379^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016379"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Reducing maternal and newborn deaths: Transforming midwifery in the Asia-Pacific region through research and innovation
column2: Investigator Grants"^"A reduction in maternal and newborn deaths and stillbirths in the Asia-Pacific region is urgently needed. Midwives can save lives; there are
column3: however
column4: significant gaps in the knowledge-base about how best to strengthen midwifery. This Investigator Grant will support primary research across the region to improve maternal and newborn health post COVID-19. The outcomes will ensure that maternal and newborn health services can withstand future shocks such as pandemics and natural disasters."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016380^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016380"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving Outcomes in Paracetamol Poisoning
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Each year paracetamol leads to >10
column3: 000 hospital presentations following deliberate self-poisoning and accidental overdose in Australia. It is also the leading cause of acute liver failure. This study aims to improve the management of paracetamol poisoning through evaluating the use and outcomes from updated 2020 guidelines and clinical studies on new tests and treatments. Outcomes from this research will aim to improve management and decrease the rate of liver injury from paracetamol poisoning."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016381^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016381"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Sewers to cures: Bacteriophages as a targeted treatment for Group B Streptococcal infections
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Group B Streptococci are bacteria that can transfer from mother to baby during birth and cause severe disease. Mothers who carry these bacteria receive antibiotics
column3: which kill the bacteria but also affects the baby’s natural beneficial bacteria. My research will investigate a century old treatment using phages
column4: viruses that kill specific bacteria. I will use advanced genetic techniques to achieve a targeted
column5: safe and effective treatment as a future alternative to antibiotic use in pregnancy."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016390^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016390"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Optimising lifelong health and development for our most immature newborns
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Extremely preterm births
column3: before 28 weeks of pregnancy
column4: carry lifelong risks to health and development. Many unanswered questions posing barriers to optimising their health and development will be addressed in this proposal. These include outcomes in their mid -30s
column5: and outcomes after change in care practices
column6: and the COVID pandemic. I will advance ways to predict individuals at highest risk
column7: and implement a surveillance program to ensure consistency and best care for this vulnerable group."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016391^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016391"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Tools to curb drug resistance in malaria parasites
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Drug resistance is a major challenge to controlling malaria. Resistant parasites emerge
column3: spread geographically & eventually render our drugs useless. We have been on a treadmill of using
column4: then losing
column5: malaria drugs for decades. I will identify antimalarial compounds to stem the spread of drug resistance. I exploit the fact that malaria must spread via mosquitoes. I find drugs for which resistant parasites get trapped in the mosquito stopping them infecting new people & spreading resistance."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016394^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016394"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Preventing harm from central venous catheters for children treated for cancer
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Children with cancer often need a central line
column3: which is a plastic tube that delivers medicine to directly to their bloodstream. Unfortunately
column4: these tubes can also cause significant harm
column5: like infections and blood clots. My research aims to change clinical practice by testing new technologies and educating healthcare workers to deliver best practice care. We expect outcomes will improve the experience and safety of care for children with cancer."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016396^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016396"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Translational studies in infectious diseases
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Testing new drugs and vaccines for infectious diseases has been impeded by difficulties in finding out how well these work in humans. I have developed a system where healthy human volunteers are experimentally infected with a microbe to test drugs or vaccines in controlled conditions. This has accelerated the development of drugs and vaccines to treat these infectious diseases. In this Program I will extend this work and establish new challenge systems to deliver new vaccines and treatments."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016399^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016399"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"The IVCare adaptive platform trial: Towards zero bloodstream infections in IV catheters
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Life-saving medical treatments are delivered into the bloodstream via intravenous (IV) catheters. This risks bacteria also entering the bloodstream through the catheter and causing a deadly whole-body infection. My research will use an advanced clinical trial design to test new medical equipment and decision support tools to block bacteria entering catheters and avoid infections during IV therapy. This will make patients safer and improve hospital care in developed and developing countries."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016406^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016406"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Optimising radiopharmaceutical therapy to improve clinical outcomes in advanced prostate cancer
column2: Investigator Grants"^"I will lead innovative clinical trials using radiopharmaceuticals to target a protein called PSMA (prostate-specific membrane antigen)
column3: which is found on most prostate cancer cells. Using scans from these trials and tiny fragments of DNA called circulating tumour DNA (ctDNA)
column4: I will try to understand why some patients respond better to PSMA radiopharmaceuticals than others. This study will lead to better and more effective treatments for advanced prostate cancer."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016407^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016407"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Evaluation of antenatal vaccines and vaccination programs in pregnancy
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Antenatal influenza
column3: pertussis and now COVID vaccines reduce the severity of these illnesses and prevent deaths in pregnancy and young babies. We need to know the uptake
column4: safety and effectiveness of these vaccines in pregnancy using large study numbers and gold standard methods. First we must ensure the way we currently collect vaccination information in pregnancy in Australia is valid. Results will be used to advocate including pregnancy status in the Australian Immunisation Register."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016410^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016410"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"From structural mechanisms of endosomal trafficking to therapies for neurodegenerative diseases
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Disruption of the endolysosomal system is directly linked to neurological dysfunction leading to dementia and other neurodegenerative disorders for which no effective treatments are available. This proposal will build on my world-leading studies of Retromer to better understand its mechanism of action and its role in sporadic and inherited neurodegenerative disorders
column3: and to ultimately deliver new molecular therapies that can promote Retromer’s neuroprotective functions."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016415^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016415"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Ensuring equitable access to care for migrants living with HIV in sub-Saharan Africa: Lessons learnt from an evaluation of Botswana’s migrant inclusive program
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Migration is a key consideration in controlling the spread of HIV. There is no formal evaluation of national HIV public health programs that are inclusive of migrants. Botswana a country in sub-Saharan Africa
column3: the epicentre of the HIV epidemic has run a migrant inclusive public program since 2020. My research will evaluate Botswana's program to document lessons learnt and explore the practicality of implementing a linked HIV surveillance system to track progress to HIV elimination."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016420^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016420"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Enhancing motor recovery after stroke using a discovery pipeline approach
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Our emergency response to stroke has significantly improved. Nevertheless
column3: many people are still left with disability
column4: and current rehabilitation interventions have limited impact. This Investigator Grant will improve rehabilitation options by advancing the way these options are developed. My work will help establish a higher standard for trials
column5: led by Australia
column6: for global use. Taken together
column7: this research will ultimately drive the most promising rehabilitation interventions into practice."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016432^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016432"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Water injections: Transforming childbirth pain management for any woman
column2: anywhere.
column3: Investigator Grants"^"Medical options for relief of childbirth pain are unavailable to many women in rural Australia. My previous research has proven that small injections of water are effective in reducing labour back pain with minimal side effects. My research aim is to develop a water injection technique that reduces abdominal labour pain that can be used safely in childbirth . This will provide a safe
column4: effective and low cost option for labour pain management for women in rural and other birthing settings."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016438^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016438"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Personalised Dementia Prevention: Clinical Trials
column2: Advanced Modelling & Biomarker Discovery
column3: Investigator Grants"^"There is no cure for dementia but understanding why some individuals are more likely to develop dementia
column4: will enable the implementation of effective strategies and treatments to help reduce the risk. This research program will use clinical trials to test new drug treatments for dementia prevention
column5: and large studies in communities of older Australians to better understand who is most at risk and why. Together this research program will deliver major advances in dementia prevention."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016461^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016461"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Drug Discovery and Chemical Biology of cell Death processes: Novel Insights and First-in-Class Therapeutics
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Cell death processes are key for our development and our health. Most diseases are linked to cell death deregulation
column3: either allowing rogue cells to survive (as in cancer) or inducing the death of healthy cells (inflammatory conditions). This program of work is focussed on developing new small molecules that modulate cell death to achieve two goals: the creation of new medicines for cancer and inflammatory diseases and the provision of new probes to better understand cell death biology."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016464^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016464"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Childhood cancer precision diagnostics and therapeutics
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Cancer is the lead cause of disease-related death in children in Australia and other developed countries. Resistance to therapy
column3: toxic side effects of treatment
column4: and delivery of effective doses of drugs to aggressive cancers are a major obstacle to cure. Our research will identify the right treatment for the right patient and target treatment delivery to cancer cells
column5: reducing toxicity to healthy tissue. This will provide better treatment options for patients with aggressive cancer."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016491^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016491"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Immunity
column2: Vaccines and Therapeutics for pandemic viruses
column3: Investigator Grants"^"Major ongoing global viral pandemics have swept the world in recent decades
column4: including SARS-CoV-2
column5: influenza and HIV. I present 3 inter-related research themes to address control of SARS-CoV-2
column6: influenza and HIV. My overall vision is to bring our understanding of immunity to SARS-CoV-2
column7: influenza and HIV to the point where we can improve vaccination strategies and treatment paradigms for these viruses."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016501^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016501"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Preventing suicide by improving mass media reporting of suicide in South Asia
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Responsible media reporting of suicide is a core suicide prevention intervention. Yet
column3: there is a profound lack of robust evidence globally on the impacts of optimised media reporting. My proposed research in the South Asia region represents a rare opportunity to conduct trials to address global evidence gaps around the impact of media interventions
column4: given the baseline context of extremely poor-quality reporting
column5: high suicide rates and limited prior suicide prevention activity."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016513^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016513"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Understanding the physiological and pathological roles for Transient Receptor Potential (TRP) channels in the mammalian cortex
column2: Investigator Grants"^"My recent discovery that transient receptor potential Ankyrin 1 (TRPA1) is expressed in rodent cortical neurons has shed light on its role in the mammalian brain. Recent studies have proposed a role for cortical TRPA1 in Alzheimer’s disease and Multiple Sclerosis
column3: and further suggested that its activation leads to neuronal death. I will investigate the physiological and pathological roles of cortical TRPA1
column4: focusing on its activation mechanisms to develop targeted therapies for these diseases."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016530^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016530"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Leveraging Polygenic Risk and Genetics for Pre-clinical Discovery in Cardiometabolic Disease
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Cardiometabolic diseases such as obesity
column3: diabetes and cardiovascular disease
column4: account for more deaths in the developed world than any other condition. Our genes play a major part in the development of these conditions
column5: however the specific causal genes remain unknown. This proposal will engage new genetic technologies to identify these specific genes
column6: whilst validation studies in lab based models and exclusive access to human datasets will ensure translational and commercial relevance."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016545^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016545"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Integrated genetic approaches to improve glaucoma diagnosis and management
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Glaucoma robs individuals of their vision; however
column3: genetic testing can identify at-risk individuals early and influence management. My research program will advance knowledge on genes and variants for glaucoma
column4: develop novel genetic testing reporting strategies for glaucoma in clinical practice
column5: and assess current genetic testing services. This work will improve glaucoma diagnosis and clinical management
column6: access to genetic services and support for patients and their families."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016547^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016547"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Pioneering data analysis methods to decrypt the cancer transcriptome
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Recent advances in technology mean that RNA
column3: the functional read-out of DNA
column4: can be sequenced to a new level of detail. However
column5: this technology results in masses of information that we do not yet have the capacity to analyse. My program will develop computational methods that will analyse RNA in cancer. This will enable us to understand the cellular events that allow cancers to develop and spread and how these can be targeted to accelerate development of new cancer therapies."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016566^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016566"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving prognosis and quality of life in children with muco-obstructive lung disease
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Cystic fibrosis and bronchiectasis are life-shortening lung conditions that develop in childhood and progress throughout life. My research is focused on early detection
column3: monitoring
column4: and treatment of these conditions to improve outcomes. Through the analysis of biological samples
column5: we can examine the early pathways associated with worse outcomes later in life. This work can identify new targets for therapies to prevent and slow disease progression
column6: and ultimately improve health outcomes."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016596^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016596"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"An integrated approach to antigen discovery in autoimmunity and cancer
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Understanding the targets of immune recognition provides insight into the molecular basis of disease; including vaccine and immunotherapy targets for infections and cancer
column3: as well as insights into aberrant immune recognition leading to autoimmune conditions. As a world leader in antigen discovery
column4: I will apply and further develop technologies to address immune specificity in a variety of cancers and autoimmune diseases to improve vaccine design
column5: immune monitoring and immunotherapies."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016598^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016598"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving the psychosocial wellbeing of adults with hearing loss through a mHealth intervention
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Hearing loss is common in Australia. People with hearing loss often avoid social situations for fear of mishearing. They can feel left out and disconnected. Hearing aids alone are not enough. Audiologists are well-placed to help people cope with these feelings. My research will develop an App to provide effective emotional support for people with hearing loss. Audiologists will be trained to support client’s using the App within routine audiological care."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016627^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016627"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Role of testosterone in preventing major morbidity in women
column2: Investigator Grants"^"This research will determine if the hormone testosterone (often considered a male hormone) can serve as a new therapy to protect against the leading causes of ill health in older women
column3: namely muscle wasting
column4: heart failure and loss of brain function. We will establish whether this same intervention can prevent premature bone loss and sexual dysfunction in younger women with premature ovarian insufficiency. These are all conditions for which there are no proven preventive interventions."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016629^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016629"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Super smart Smartphones: Sensing changes in mental health and delivering just-in-time adaptive interventions
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Body image concerns impact more than a third of young people and are linked with eating disorders
column3: anxiety
column4: depression and suicidality. This program of research will harness the popularity of smartphones to predict when young people are struggling with their body image from the way they are using their phones
column5: and provide the right level of personalised support via “just in time” online interventions. If effective
column6: this work will translate into improved body image for at-risk young people."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016641^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016641"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Reducing infectious complications in kidney transplant recipients
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Infections commonly occur following kidney transplantation and are associated with significant morbidity and mortality. My research program addresses this public health burden by designing clinical trials that are of critical importance to patients
column3: caregivers and healthcare professionals. My aim is to ensure views of patients and caregivers are addressed so that my research is relevant to our nephrology community. My research program will benefit patients both in Australia and also globally."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016647^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016647"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Reducing antibiotic overprescribing in dentistry
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Dentists prescribe over 800
column3: 000 antibiotic prescriptions yearly and 55% are overprescribed. The aim of this multimodal study is to improve dental prescribing by determining the patient factors that influence dental antibiotic prescribing and providing dentists with a clinical decision prescribing tool
column4: Drugs4dent
column5: to improve prescribing. The outcome is aimed to be improved dental antibiotic use
column6: and transforming the access to drug knowledge for dentists."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016662^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016662"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving Outcomes for Preterm Infants Through Randomised Clinical Trials
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Babies who are born early (premature) can face many health challenges. My research focuses on ways to improve how we care for premature babies in the first days and weeks of life
column3: especially by supporting their breathing. I also want to explore new ways of doing research studies in premature babies so that we can get better at answering the most important questions. By improving the way we care for premature babies early in their lives
column4: we can improve their health into childhood and even beyond."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016667^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016667"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Implementation research to improve hepatitis C testing and treatment in rural and regional Australia
column2: Investigator Grants"^"I will use implementation research to increase access to hepatitis C testing and treatment in primary care in Western Victoria
column3: and eliminate hepatitis C as a public health threat. Using data from this and a similar project in Cairns
column4: I will determine which interventions are cost-effective in regional settings. Finally
column5: I will help underserved regional areas in Australia to have better access to cost-effective testing and treatment in primary care
column6: especially for people who inject drugs."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016668^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016668"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Identifying opportunities to reverse the diabetes epidemic: surveillance of diabetes
column2: its complications and mortality
column3: Investigator Grants"^"Diabetes is a serious disease causing deadly
column4: disabling and costly complications. We need data to help us manage this pandemic. My research will tell us which complications are increasing and who are most at risk
column5: in Australia and worldwide. It will also tell us which interventions are most effective. Together
column6: this understanding will improve care for people with diabetes. It will ensure that interventions are well targeted which will in turn limit the global health expenditure on diabetes."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016686^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016686"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Harnessing long noncoding RNAs for cancer diagnosis and treatment
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Cancer cells exploit a newly discovered class of molecules for their growth and resistance to treatment. This research program will develop a better understanding of how these molecules influence cancer initiation
column3: progression
column4: and treatment response. It will also uncover new biomarkers that reveal the presence of cancer
column5: as well as new molecular targets for anti-cancer drugs. Findings from this research will pave the way towards earlier detection of cancer and more effective cancer treatments."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016688^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016688"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Targeted neuroprotective treatments for fetal and neonatal brain injury
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Neonatal brain injury is common in infants born preterm
column3: with fetal growth restriction
column4: or who suffer a severe lack of oxygen at birth. Having previously identified the neuropathology specific to these complications
column5: I will now examine targeted neuroprotective treatments that address the specific mechanisms of brain injury. The results of my preclinical studies will inform clinical trials offering new therapies to reduce neonatal brain injury and prevent life-long neurodevelopment deficits."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016695^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016695"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving alcohol and other drug policy by focussing on values
column2: Investigator Grants"^"What should governments do about alcohol and illicit drugs? The policies that are chosen need to be informed by evidence and reflect the goals and values of communities. This program of work on the role of values in policy development will result in more effective and value-aligned alcohol and illicit drug policies such that the harms experienced across communities from these substances can be reduced."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016698^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016698"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Strengthening Australian Infectious Disease Clinical Research with a focus on vulnerable populations
column2: Investigator Grants"^"This research aims to study treatments for infectious diseases that affect particularly vulnerable communities including people who inject drugs and people living with HIV. It focuses on finding solutions that will aid progress towards elimination of hepatitis B and C
column3: and towards managing the pandemics of HIV and COVID-19
column4: through the establishment of high quality international collaborative clinical research."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016706^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016706"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Alcohol's harm to others
column2: Investigator Grants"^"This project aims to measure alcohol's harms to others
column3: beyond the drinker
column4: within families
column5: communities
column6: societies and public services. Using a new Australian survey
column7: in-depth interviews and health
column8: crime and welfare system datasets
column9: the project will study how individuals
column11: systems and policies respond to problems caused by others’ drinking. The study will model how reduced heavy drinking will decrease harm from others' drinking

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016719^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016719"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Transforming health literacy in Australia: a partnership approach
column2: Investigator Grants"^"This program will develop interventions to build health literacy and shared decision making. It will also improve the health system’s capacity to meet the communication needs of people with low health literacy. This program will produce co-designed and tested evidence-based interventions that combine behavioural science with digital innovation and knowledge translation for scalable interventions to improve health literacy nationally and internationally."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016726^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016726"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"P. vivax Serological Testing & Treatment: a novel intervention to facilitate malaria elimination
column2: Investigator Grants"^"This research program aims to develop the diagnostic tools and clinical trials evidence to prove that a new public health intervention
column3: P. vivax Serological Test and Treat (SeroTAT) can facilitate PV elimination in vivax endemic countries world-wide. To achieve this
column4: we will develop a new class of malaria point-of-care sero-diagnostic test that can identify those most at risk of recurrent vivax malaria
column5: and prove that treating these people will significantly reduce P. vivax transmission."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016729^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016729"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving Labour Induction Outcomes
column2: Investigator Grants"^"About 1 in 3 Australian women have an induction of labour - an artificial intervention to stimulate the onset of labour when indicated. We know who should have induction of labour and when
column3: but not much about how (which method to use) and where (stay in hospital or at home) to induce labour. In this program
column4: I will lead one international collaborative project
column5: one pragmatic multi-centre clinical trial
column6: and one multi-centre observational study to provide unequivocal answers to these questions."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016730^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016730"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Screening of athletes for cardiovascular disesase and prevention of sudden death
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Sudden cardiac death (SCD) in athletes is a rare but tragic event. Screening programs to prevent SCD are recommended but data are lacking for some groups (indigenous Australians
column3: female athletes) and across sports. The project will develop Australia’s first national registry of athlete screening ECGs
column4: focus on under-represented groups
column5: and make comparisons across sports. The ultimate goal is to improve the accuracy and quality of screening programs to prevent SCD."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016732^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016732"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Leveraging Nanoparticle Platforms to Advance Nanomedicine
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Nanoparticles (NPs) afford a revolutionary approach of packaging and delivering medicines to target specific sites within patients. This proposal will address current limitations in NP-based medicines
column3: by understanding and engineering the performance of NPs
column4: and through their reproducible and scalable synthesis. With a focus on cancer
column5: and infectious and neurological diseases
column6: this research will progress nanomedicines towards preclinical studies and commercialisation to improve health outcomes."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016756^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016756"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"N-3 (Omega-3) precision nutrition: preventing prematurity and enhancing cognitive development of very preterm children
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Being born too soon can be devastating for children and their families. My work is designed to overcome omega-3 deficiency in Australian pregnant women to prevent some of those early births. For babies born more than 11 weeks before their due date
column3: my research aims to maximise developmental benefits by feeding extra omega-3 fats in the neonatal unit to match what would have been received in the womb."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016792^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016792"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Malaria volunteer infection studies for the advancement of antimalarial therapeutics
column2: Investigator Grants"^"At QIMR Berghofer I will lead malaria volunteer infection studies to advance the development of antimalarial therapeutics. This will include studies to characterise the PK/PD profile of existing antimalarials to optimise dose selection
column3: evaluate the transmission blocking activity of new and existing antimalarials
column4: and evaluate strategies to boost antimalarial immunity. These studies will inform antimalarial treatment strategies worldwide."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016801^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016801"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Prevention of cardiometabolic conditions in diverse populations
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Cardiometabolic conditions (including heart disease and diabetes) are a leading cause of premature death and poor health in Australia and globally. My research will focus on identifying effective preventive treatments and methods to deliver these treatments to high-risk populations in Australia and other countries in our region
column3: particularly to groups that have not previously had their needs adequately addressed. A focus will be on novel use of affordable and effective preventive drug therapies."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016803^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016803"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Alzheimer's disease: causes
column2: natural history
column3: early diagnosis and prevention
column4: Investigator Grants"^"Alzheimer’s disease (AD) is a devastating illness for a large number of people in our aging community. We have discovered the major causes of AD from our work over the past 40 years. We are now poised to develop disease modifying therapies (both pharmacological and non-pharmacological) and apply these therapies for prevention. We have defined when and where in the brain AD starts. Armed with this knowledge
column5: we can implement diagnostic and therapeutic strategies for prevention."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016819^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016819"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Dietary protein to improve outcomes from critical illness
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Critically ill patients are admitted to an intensive care unit (ICU) to receive life support therapies but suffer rapid and severe muscle wasting. Dr Deane will evaluate whether increasing dietary protein using existing formula or specific amino acid supplements reduces muscle wasting. This program will determine whether there is a pragmatic and inexpensive solution for a condition that results in considerable mortality and morbidity to a large number of Australians each year."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016820^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016820"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Deregulated epigenetics and transcription in cancer
column2: Investigator Grants"^"The Investigator grant will support Prof. Ricky Johnstone
column3: a world leader in cancer research. His work focusses on how genes are regulated in normal and cancer cells through a process called epigenetics
column4: and how de-regulated gene expression can result in cancer onset and progression. He and his team will determine how manipulating the proteins and pathways that control the expression of genes can inhibit cancer cell growth and survival
column5: and regulate how our immune system responds to cancer."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016822^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016822"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Translating Genomics into Improved Care of Inherited Heart Disease and Sudden Death Families
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Inherited heart diseases are caused by errors in genes we are born with. These genetic errors can lead to heart muscle and rhythm disorders
column3: which can cause sudden cardiac death in the young. This proposed research will use the latest clinical
column4: genetic
column5: and cellular approaches to identify what these genetic errors are
column6: how these errors cause these clinical diseases
column7: and how we can use this new knowledge to improve the care of patients with inherited heart diseases and prevent sudden death."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016825^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016825"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving Knowledge and Interventions to reduce and prevent substance use related harms
column2: Investigator Grants"^"I will study the epidemiology of illicit drug use
column3: and improve estimates of substance use and mental disorders and health burden; and study prospective associations between disorders and harms. I will lead globally focused work on the epidemiology and harms of illicit drugs
column4: and coverage of interventions to reduce harm; and examine interventions to address drug use
column5: including treatment of opioid dependence and other interventions to reduce harm among people who use illicit drugs."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016826^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016826"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Illuminating the dark genome in cancer
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Research into the genetic basis of cancer has largely focused on the 2% of human DNA that codes for proteins (what most people refer to as "genes"). In the last decade
column3: it has become clear that a large proportion of DNA outside these genes (referred to as noncoding regions) is functional and can harbour genetic and epigenetic alterations that can promote the development of cancer. This research program will explore the contribution of these noncoding regions to cancer development."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016827^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016827"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Capturing atomic snapshots to visualise epigenetic silencing machinery for identification of novel therapeutic targets
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Heterochromatin
column3: a tightly packed form of DNA prevents genes from being turned on. We know very little about heterochromatin biology at molecular level
column4: despite its critical role in gene silencing. Through cryo-electron microscopy (cryoEM)
column5: I will study the protein complexes that lead to heterochromatin formation and maintenance. This information will enable the rational design of a targeted drug discovery program to treat diseases caused by epigenetic dysregulation."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016833^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016833"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Using MRI tools to map and mitigate brain harms in chronic cannabis use
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Australia has one of the highest rates of cannabis dependence
column3: and 28% of users report high distress and mental illness. Yet
column4: the neurobiology of cannabis use is unclear. I will fill this knowledge gap by combining advanced brain imaging tools with large longitudinal datasets to map the brain mechanisms which predate
column5: predict and underpin chronic cannabis use
column6: and by trialling new interventions that directly target and mitigate brain dysfunction in chronic cannabis use."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016841^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016841"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Understanding the autoimmune response against the brain to improve diagnosis and therapy of neuroimmunological disorders
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Neuroimmunological disorders include neurological and psychiatric disorders affecting the brain
column3: spinal cord
column4: and nerves. Overall
column5: they can affect up to 1% of the human population. They almost always result in a poor quality of life for children and adults and are a high cost burden for the community. The research program will explore the dysregulation of the immune system in these patients and will design new diagnostic and therapeutic approaches."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016851^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016851"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Optimising strategies for control of neglected tropical diseases
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Neglected tropical diseases (NTDs) are a group of health conditions that affect the poorest of the poor
column3: particularly in remote and rural areas. They affect the most vulnerable communities and cause substantial
column4: chronic health harms impairing personal and social development. Several debilitating NTDs are common in remote indigenous communities and Pacific islands. I propose a series of studies to investigate new strategies to control NTDs in large populations where these diseases are endemic."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016866^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016866"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"A pathway to new symptomatic drug therapies in dementia
column2: Investigator Grants"^"The cognitive symptoms of dementia can be devastating for patients and their families. The drugs that are currently available to treat these symptoms are limited and they do not work for everyone. My program will identify new drug treatment options for cognitive symptoms
column3: and
column4: establish faster ways to help us translate these drugs into clinical practice – so that people with dementia can benefit from novel treatment options as soon as possible."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016876^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016876"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Repetitive Neurotrauma and the Risk for Dementia in Former Athletes
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Contact and collision sports have been popular in Australia for generations
column3: and many millions of people
column4: worldwide
column5: played these sports during their youth. There is tremendous societal concern about whether exposure to concussions and repetitive blows to the head during youth leads to accelerated brain aging and risk for neurological disease later in life. This project will make important advancements in medical and scientific knowledge relating to the long-term brain health of former athletes."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016884^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016884"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Building RNA therapies to re-program gene expression.
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Gene mutations cause a wide range of inherited diseases. The delivery of mRNA therapies can replace mutated genes. However
column3: mRNA therapies must be correctly expressed in the diseased tissue and match the expression of the mutated gene. I propose to build a toolkit of RNA structures that control expression of mRNA therapies in different tissues. This will allow their correct expression of mRNA therapies in disease tissues and a new opportunity to treat these currently incurable diseases."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016894^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016894"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Using advanced structural biology to exploit BCL2 effector proteins for new tailored therapies.
column2: Investigator Grants"^"This research aims to identify new cancer drugs like venetoclax
column3: which has revolutionised leukemia therapy by targeting one of eight BCL2 family proteins involved in cell death. Using Australia’s leading facilities
column4: eg. the National Drug Discovery Center and Australian Synchrotron
column5: this research will investigate the structure and function of three additional BCL2 proteins. This is expected to lead to new classes of drugs that can treat diseases where current therapies fail."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016907^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016907"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"BREATHE EASY - respiratory protection against airborne threats
column2: Investigator Grants"^"MacIntyre is a leading international researcher & woman with a 15-year track record of mask research. This will enable critical research on masks; aerosols & how they are blocked by masks; and development of a novel
column3: sustainable mask to meet global needs. These are seamlessly connected within a new NHMRC CRE
column4: BREATHE on mitigation of airborne threats to health
column5: which she leads. She has strong policy and industry links to ensure this research results in global solutions in respiratory protection."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016908^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016908"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Antibody-based therapies against infectious diseases
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Infectious diseases have resulted in devastating mortality in human populations throughout history. Antibody-based therapies have revolutionised modern medicine and will be important for the prevention and treatment of diseases caused by some of the world’s deadliest pathogens. Our program builds on a deep understanding of the molecular interactions between human and pathogen and leverages advanced antibody platforms to develop novel antibody therapies against malaria and COVID-19."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016909^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016909"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Optimising the investment in real-time prescription drug monitoring
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Opioid prescribing has increased substantially in recent times and is associated with significant harms. Various approaches have been adopted to prevent these harms
column3: however research has shown some approaches add to harms. This research aims to better understand the impact of prescription drug monitoring programs on clinical decision-making and how these impact patient and population level outcomes."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016930^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016930"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Anti-fibrotic targeting and biosensor imaging in pancreatic cancer (PC): taking cancer targeting to new dimensions
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Pancreatic cancer is a devastating disease in which high levels of dense tissue (otherwise know as fibrosis) surrounds the tumour and effectively protects the tumour from efficient drug delivery and penetrance
column3: causing poor drug response. In this program of work
column4: we outline how we can target this dense impenetrable fibrotic tissue to effectively improve drug delivery and response in this aggressive disease."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016947^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016947"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Preventing pulmonary complications after major surgery
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Contracting a chest infection after major surgery can be catastrophic. Despite the seriousness of this complication
column3: we know little about how common it is
column4: how much it costs hospitals
column5: and how it impacts a person’s recovery after surgery. My research will provide world-first data on the impact of chest infections after major surgery
column6: treatment guidelines for clinicians
column7: and online methods to deliver breathing training before surgery - a treatment known to prevent chest infections after surgery."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016951^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016951"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Phosphoinositide signalling in disease
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Breast cancer is the most common cancer in women. Current treatment protocols are initially effective; however
column3: more than half of patients experience relapse presenting an urgent need for new therapies. Lipid signals within cells can be hyperactivated in breast cancer promoting tumour growth and spread. We have discovered genes that regulate these signals
column4: that when altered lead to poor outcomes in breast cancer. Here we will investigate these events to identify new biomarkers and therapies."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016969^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016969"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Antigen Presentation and Adaptive Immunity
column2: Investigator Grants"^"The research program I will carry out during this fellowship will characterise how the immune system detects and starts responses against pathogens and cancer cells. I will describe proteins and intracellular processes required to fulfil this function
column3: which may be harnessed to develop more effective vaccines against infections
column4: protect critically ill patients from hospital acquired infections
column5: prevent autoimmunity and fight cancer."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016991^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016991"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Patient-Specific CT-Derived Computational Modelling to Optimise Outcomes in Aortic Stenosis
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Transcatheter aortic valve replacement (TAVR) has revolutionised the treatment of aortic stenosis by offering a less invasive alternative to open heart surgery. This study aims to use non-invasive images from cardiac CT to develop a novel
column3: personalised technique that allow clinicians to perform 3D simulation of aortic valve implantation that predicts short and long term clinical outcomes. These results will provide new tools to make TAVR safer
column4: more durable and accessible to more patients."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016995^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2016995"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"A multidisciplinary approach to reducing complications with extracorporeal membrane oxygenation
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Critically-ill patients with heart and/or lung failure (including COVID19) may require advanced life support using a device called ECMO. Current ECMO systems are riddled with complications related to the patient-device interface
column3: such as a poor surgical connection and a lack of regular and life-like clinical training. This project will improve the ECMO-patient interface through better devices and improved clinical training
column4: and measure improvements in patient outcomes using large databases."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017001^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017001"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Discovery and validation of antifibrotic therapies for kidney disease
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Kidney failure is increasing by 6-12% annually
column3: directly costing up to $1.8B pa. Despite optimum treatment of patients with chronic kidney disease
column4: dialysis
column5: kidney transplant or premature death ensues. This program will assess new treatments for which we have promising preliminary data & dissect differences in the processes leading to kidney recovery vs irreparable damage after kidney injury. Consequently
column6: new therapies will be developed and the next generation of scientists will be trained."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017012^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017012"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Smart technology for hip osteoarthritis: a personalised real-world ‘move’ into the future
column2: Investigator Grants"^"My program will design and test a new treatment for hip osteoarthritis (OA). The team I lead has proven that people with hip OA load their hip in a detrimental way during daily activities
column3: and that hip load can be improved with laboratory-based movement retraining. To translate changes into everyday life
column4: retraining must now happen in the real-world. My program will partner authentically with stakeholders to co-develop a body-worn smart device for personalised self-management in the real-world."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017023^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017023"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Statistical bioinformatics at single cell resolution
column2: Investigator Grants"^"This program will generate a framework and innovative bioinformatics tools to extract disease-associated signatures from multiple-modality single cell platforms for large cohort studies. Our strategy is based on contextual focus machine learning methods and novel statistical models to identify stable relationships among clinical and molecular measurements with robust predictive power across multiple platforms. This will accelerate the process of translational significant biomedical research."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017033^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017033"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Optimising novel therapies to improve lymphoma patient outcomes
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Lymphomas are blood cancers that can be cured in some patients
column3: but current treatments cause major side effects and many patients still die from this devastating disease. My research brings together clinical trials testing new therapies that manipulate the immune system
column4: studies of blood and biopsy abnormalities
column5: and new types of scans
column6: in patients receiving these and standard treatments
column7: with studies of real-world registry data
column8: to improve treatment options and outcomes for lymphoma patients."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017060^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017060"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Circulating tumour DNA informed management of early-stage colorectal cancer and pancreas cancer
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Colorectal or pancreas cancer is treated with surgery
column3: then potentially chemotherapy
column4: with that decision informed by examination of the cancer tissue that has been removed. This remains an imprecise way of estimating risk of recurrence and possible benefit from chemotherapy. My initial studies show that a blood test for circulating tumour DNA is a far more precise way of determining recurrence risk. I am leading 4 randomised studies looking to prove the benefit of ctDNA informed management."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017070^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017070"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Using muscle-directed gene delivery to study and treat disease
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Effective therapeutics are urgently required to combat the debilitating effects of skeletal muscle-related disease. This program of research will examine how cellular mechanisms control the functionality of skeletal muscle in health and disease
column3: to pursue the development of innovative muscle-directed therapeutics to eradicate the loss of skeletal muscle mass and function as a cause of morbidity and early death
column4: and combat other serious non-muscle diseases."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017080^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017080"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving Outcomes for People with Bone Metastases
column2: Investigator Grants"^"MOST people with advanced cancer will develop bone metastases – where cancer spreads to bone. This leads to devastating physical and mental problems including bone fragility
column3: bone pain and muscle weakness
column4: along with distress
column5: anxiety and depression. My previous work has proven that carefully prescribed exercise is SAFE for these high-risk people. Now
column6: I aim to establish the clinical effectiveness of supervised and targeted exercise to strengthen muscle
column7: rescue bone loss
column8: and improve function."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017081^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017081"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving outcomes for ICU survivors with anaemia
column2: Investigator Grants"^"More than 170
column3: 000 Australians require intensive care treatment each year. At discharge
column4: nearly half are anaemic. This impairs recovery
column5: increasing the risk of prolonged and repeated hospitalisation. My research has identified promising anaemia treatments. This Fellowship will allow me to generate high quality evidence to guide practice and policy with the aim of improving recovery after ICU. I will also develop new blood tests that will enable these treatments to be personalised."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017086^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017086"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Mechanistic and pharmacological insights into peripheral sensory neuron function in physiological and pathological pain
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Chronic pain is a major health issue in Australia and globally. Many currently used pain killers are associated with serious side effects or do not provide adequate relief for patients. One promising approach to develop better drugs is to directly modify activity of peripheral pain-sensing nerves
column3: which often respond abnormally in pain states. This proposal seeks to better understand the molecular mechanisms of pain to facilitate future development of mechanism-based therapeutics."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017125^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017125"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Fear extinction as an experimental model for PTSD treatments and course
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Treating psychiatric disorders such as posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) is challenging because the biological and cognitive processes involved in the disorders are unclear. This project will benchmark current experimental models of PTSD against real world clinical outcomes
column3: such as treatment success and disease course. The project will design new and data-informed methods for experimentally modelling processes involved PTSD
column4: leading to novel tools that will help to improve PTSD treatments."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017131^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017131"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Development of a bench to bedside platform for novel therapy development for psychiatric disorders
column2: Investigator Grants"^"My vision for the next five years is to conceptualise
column3: coordinate and lead a program for the bench to bedside development
column4: validation and translation of new
column5: evidence-based therapies for the most prevalent and disabling neuropsychiatric disorders
column6: in particular depression
column7: bipolar disorder
column8: and schizophrenia."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017138^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017138"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Extracellular vesicles-based drug delivery for cancer therapy
column2: Investigator Grants"^"This research program aims to develop a novel treatment for metastatic breast cancer with the use of milk derived packages
column3: an agent with anti-cancer properties. Late-stage breast cancer patients suffer from treatment failure and severe side effects from chemotherapy. Loading drugs into these packages will enhance the delivery
column4: treatment response and limit the side effects. This will ultimately result in positive impact on the quality of life of cancer patients."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017139^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017139"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Optimising metabolic and mental health in the management of adolescent obesity
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Effective treatment for adolescent obesity is vital. However
column3: a subset of adolescents with obesity are vulnerable to eating disorders. This research brings together a collaboration of obesity and eating disorder researchers
column4: clinicians and consumers to understand: 1) The prevalence of mental health concerns in adolescents with obesity; 2) How to identify adolescents at risk of developing an eating disorder; and 3) How to optimise obesity treatment to improve both physical and mental health"^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017140^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017140"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Advancing dynamic MRI to enable adaptive lung radiotherapy
column2: Investigator Grants"^"MRI-Linacs are cutting-edge treatment machines that use magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) to image tumour anatomy and biological function with unrivalled quality while radiation therapy is performed with a linear accelerator (Linac). This program will use MRI technology to dynamically track moving lung tumours and identify radioresistant tumour tissue responsible for treatment failure. MRI-Linac advances will enable lung cancer radiation treatments with unprecedented accuracy and efficacy."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017170^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017170"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Implementation research: Delivering impact at the health-food retail interface for healthy food environments
column2: with Indigenous communities
column3: Investigator Grants"^"How food is promoted
column4: priced and made available in food retail impacts consumer behaviour and subsequently population health. In partnership with communities
column5: Aboriginal health services
column6: the retail sector and policy-makers
column7: I will generate new knowledge on determinants of
column8: and effective strategies to address
column9: dietary inequity for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples through a focus on the remote store environment
column11: and establish a global remote store collaborative."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017176^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017176"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Understanding the Genetic Basis of Treatment Response for Depression
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Depression is the most common psychiatric disorder and is most commonly trated with antidepressant medicationd and psychological therapy. However
