column3: many people discontinue treatment due to experiencing adverse side effects or experiencing no remission in symptoms. I aim to identify genetic factors that influence depression treatment response by analyzing large-scale genetic data. These insights could be used to understand who is most likely to benefit from certain types of treatment."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017197^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017197"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"A Metagenomics Platform to Prevent Future Pandemics
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Genome sequence data has transformed the study of emerging diseases. However
column3: large-scale metagenomic data are cumbersome to analyse and have not been widely used for virus surveillance. This research programme will transform our understanding of the disease threat to Australian and global populations by developing a new bioinformatics pipeline to rapidly and identify viruses of potential public health impact and by performing a metagenomic survey of viruses at the animal-human interface."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017220^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017220"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Neural regulation of immunity
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Immune responses are essential for the body to fight infections and cancer. It is well appreciated that communication occurs between the nervous system and the immune system
column3: but how this occurs is unclear. Using new tools
column4: genomics and highly advanced imaging
column5: this project will define interactions between the nervous system and the immune system that can be precisely targeted to improve therapies and vaccines for infectious diseases and cancer."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017223^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017223"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Innovative screening and treatment approaches for diabetic complications
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Diabetes is complicated by damage to the kidney leading to kidney failure and injury to blood vessels leading to heart attacks
column3: strokes and amputations. My program will validate novel biomarkers for earlier detection and will develop novel and better treatments for diabetic complications
column4: including in the Indigenous population. I will initiate clinical trials and translate into practice. As a clinician/ scientist my mission is to reduce the high health burden of diabetes and its complications."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017225^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017225"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Detection and treatment of brain injury in growth restricted newborns
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Babies that grow slowly before birth are more likely to suffer brain damage. There is no way to prevent this brain damage
column3: it is difficult to detect
column4: and there are no treatments. These babies often face a challenging life
column5: with many problems including autism
column6: ADHD
column7: or cerebral palsy. My work will provide new knowledge on not only tests to detect brain damage to identify these babies earlier
column8: this project will also explore treatments to improve life-long outcomes for these children."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017229^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017229"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving strategies to combat preventable infections
column2: Investigator Grants"^"People living in and visiting resource-poor settings are at increased risk of exposure to infections spread through food
column3: water
column4: mosquitoes and the environment. Preventive strategies that should reduce infection exposure often have limited success in the real world. My research aims to understand and overcome the barriers that limit the effectiveness and uptake of key preventive strategies (such as improved water supplies and vaccination)
column5: to improve health outcomes in vulnerable populations."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017233^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017233"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Functional amplification of stem cells for tissue repair
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Stem cells are increasingly being used to treat a diverse range of diseases. However
column3: for such therapies to be clinically feasible and widely accessible
column4: a large supply of quality stem cells are needed. Current methods of manufacturing stem cells are inadequate and expensive. This work aims to develop a safe
column5: cost-effective
column6: robust and more efficient way of propagating and preparing stem cells
column7: by exploiting the potent
column8: versatile actions of a human elastic protein on cell lifespan and behaviour."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017256^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017256"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Unlocking precision medicine for 'incurable' child cancers
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Although personalised medicine programs for children with cancer are better matching drugs to their molecular targets
column3: the outlook remains dismal for patients with aggressive high-risk disease. I will develop new optimised combination therapies for treating these children
column4: develop a new drug to prevent and treat childhood cancer
column5: and develop new diagnostics to better predict treatment response and optimise personalised therapy
column6: with the singular goal of improving patient outcomes."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017257^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017257"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Building best-in-class bioinformatics tools to drive next generation biomedical research
column2: Investigator Grants"^"To get a complete picture of disease
column3: the analysis of data obtained from cutting edge biotechnologies applied to clinical samples is essential. To do this successfully
column4: advanced statistical methods are needed. I will develop new software tools and curate large collections of molecular information to improve understanding of healthy ageing and disease processes. The tools will be freely available to researchers anywhere and will drive new discoveries and disease treatments."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017267^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017267"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Beyond translation: Integrating clinical trials and intelligent health systems for stroke
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Over the next 5 years my research will generate new knowledge with new clinical trials
column3: novel AI-driven stroke assessment tools
column4: and integrated telehealth technologies to enhance rural and regional stroke care. My research will leverage globally unique imaging and biobank data capabilities and my extensive national and international clinical trials network. These will drive the next phase of my successful track record of clinical translation."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017278^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017278"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Evaluation and implementation of a digital health literacy tool to improve written health information
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Providing health information that all people can easily understand is a key step towards a fair and safe public health system
column3: and one that empowers people to become active participants in their own health care. However
column4: we currently lack sophisticated and scalable tools to achieve this goal. This project will evaluate a new online text-editing tool that helps health care providers write health information more simply
column5: and provide strategies to increase its uptake within health organisations."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017279^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017279"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Biomarker discovery informs precision medicine in childhood epilepsy
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Epilepsy is a common problem affecting 3% of the general population
column3: and is associated with comorbidities
column4: affects the quality of life and poses safety risks. However
column5: if diagnosed and treated appropriately
column6: seizures can be reversed
column7: improving morbidity and mortality. My program will generate novel biomarkers on a large clinical registry of refractory epilepsy patients to increase understanding of underlying disease processes and to provide patient specific precision medicine."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017282^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017282"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Linking Brains: Histology
column2: MRI
column3: Connectivity and Functional Maps of Humans and Mice
column4: Investigator Grants"^"This project uses imaging techniques to produce a new generation of brain atlases. It will advance our understanding of the organisation and connections of the human brain as well as that of the most commonly used animal to model human disease––the mouse. The atlases will inform the development of psychotherapeutic drugs and result in more accurate interventions on the human brain. The new maps will assist those who study the brain of patients with diseases such as Alzheimer’s and Parkinson’s."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017284^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017284"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Evolutionary genomics to inform outbreak responses
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Genomics has been essential to track recent pandemics
column3: including those of COVID-19
column4: Ebola
column5: and drug-resistant bacteria. This project will develop methods to integrate epidemiological and genomic data
column6: for a comprehensive system of infectious disease surveillance that will constantly update estimates of pathogen introductions and infectious spread. Implementation of these techniques in public health will dramatically increase the value of information for pandemic preparedness and mitigation."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017289^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017289"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Determining cellular competency in the mammary gland
column2: Investigator Grants"^"A mother’s ability to produce a nutritionally complete source of food for her baby is of central importance to human health. However
column3: we understand very little about the cells in the breast that produce and secrete milk. I will visualise and quantify the function of individual cells in this tissue to better understand their behaviours and to improve our knowledge of the cellular functions and characteristics that can contribute to the development and progression of breast cancers."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017295^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017295"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"One size does not fit all: achieving patient-centred deprescribing through evidence-based
column2: individualised interventions
column3: Investigator Grants"^"Reducing medicines (deprescribing) through stopping medicines or taking less medicines is a positive intervention that improves health outcomes. Deprescribing should be tailored and patient-centred
column4: but it is complex and unclear how this can be achieved. This body of work will explore and develop evidence-based tools to enable individualised communication about deprescribing. This will ensure patients and GPs make good decisions about medicines use in older age."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017299^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017299"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Deciphering the rules of T cell residency across intestinal compartments
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Tissue-resident memory T cells (TRM) are key for immune protection against infection at barrier sites such as the gut. While much of our understanding of gut TRM comes from studies on the small intestine
column3: how these cells develop and function in the large intestine is unknown. This project aims to identify and modulate molecular pathways by which the intestinal microenvironment influences TRM development specifically in the small or large intestine to enhance immune protection against infections."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017302^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017302"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Dietitian-led intervention for physical health disparities in people living with severe mental illness
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Nutrition is a critical underlying issue for the significantly higher rates of chronic diseases
column3: such as heart disease
column4: experienced by people living with severe mental illness. Best practice nutrition intervention is yet to be determined. This project builds on promising pilot projects to determine the most effective interventions and to translate this into practice by formalising a clinical care process for dietitians and a resource for consumers to advocate for best practice nutrition support."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017325^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017325"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Delivering Precision Medicine to Population-based Cancer Prevention
column2: Investigator Grants"^"My program will build upon my landmark studies that have demonstrated cancer risk factors that are modifications of DNA (epigenomic) rather than mutation of DNA (genomic) by building new
column3: accurate prediction tools for cancer risk in the general population. This research program will advance cancer risk screening by including both epigenomic and genomic assessment and make it widely available in Australia to prevent cases of cancer and to develop new medicines for those who do develop cancer."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017335^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017335"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Gatekeepers of optimal T cell immune function in health and aging-related decline
column2: Investigator Grants"^"T cells protect from infectious disease and cancers
column3: and boosting T cell activation is the goal of current immunotherapies. In older individuals
column4: T cells become dysfunctional placing the elderly at much greater risk. However
column5: precisely what is required for effective T cell activation
column6: and what goes wrong in older individuals
column7: remains poorly understood. This study will advance fundamental knowledge around T cell activation
column8: critical for the ongoing development and optimisation of immunotherapies."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017353^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017353"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Uncovering new targets for cancer immunotherapy through multiplexed genomic screens in cytotoxic T cells
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Immunotherapy is a modern approach to treat cancer and works by training the immune system
column3: particularly T cells
column4: to attack cancer cells. Immunotherapies are proving to be very successful in treating certain cancers
column5: however
column6: not all patients respond positively to this treatment for reasons that are still unclear. This project will identify the genetic factors that determine whether T cells have the capacity to fight cancer and discover new ways to improve patient responses to immunotherapy."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017370^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017370"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Fallopian tube on-a-chip for understanding human reproduction
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Infertility is on the rise
column3: affecting >180 million individuals worldwide. However
column4: our knowledge of fertilisation is still insufficient and advances in treatment methods are infrequent. This project aims to develop new microfluidic technologies that closely represent the physiology and function of the female fallopian tube to directly study human reproduction. The project expects to bring new insights into unknown causes of infertility and improve treatment methods worldwide."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017373^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017373"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Reducing the Breast Cancer Burden in Young Women
column2: Investigator Grants"^"I aim to reduce the breast cancer burden in young women by finding out the causes of breast cancer in young women and how cancer risk can be accurately predicted and prevented. I will also investigate the future health of young women diagnosed with breast cancer so that health support is provided to young survivors."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017382^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017382"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Targeting the gut microbiota to treat cardiovascular disease
column2: Investigator Grants"^"After four decades of research
column3: we now know the association between fibre intake and lower blood pressure is dependent on our gut microbes. While our bodies are incapable of digesting some types of fibre
column4: it feeds the community of ‘good’ bacteria
column5: resulting in the release of substances that can lower blood pressure. In the next 5 years
column6: I will establish how these substances lower blood pressure and test their use to treat patients."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017383^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017383"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"A comprehensive vaccine-based strategy to combat gonorrhoea
column2: Investigator Grants"^"The sexually transmitted infection gonorrhoea has a significant impact on global health
column3: with 100 million cases/year
column4: many of which are associated with infertility and increased HIV transmission. Due to increasing antimicrobial resistance and the absence of a vaccine
column5: the WHO has classified gonorrhoea an urgent threat to public health that requires immediate action. My research aims to develop a vaccine to prevent gonorrhoea from becoming an untreatable ‘superbug’ in the near future."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017388^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017388"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Sickly sweet: managing high blood glucose during and post critical illness
column2: Investigator Grants"^"High blood sugar levels occur frequently during critical illness even in patients without a history of diabetes. High blood sugar levels are associated with increased mortality in ICU and an increased risk of developing diabetes in survivors. My research will; (i) determine the efficacy of a new drug to manage high sugar levels in the ICU
column3: (ii) identify mechanisms of how high blood sugar levels in ICU lead to diabetes
column4: and
column5: (iii) determine whether this can be prevented with screening programs."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017404^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017404"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Developing microbiome-based interventions to improve vaccine immunogenicity
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Effective vaccination is critical for combating infectious disease. However
column3: vaccine immune responses are highly variable between individuals and populations (e.g. lower in the elderly). New evidence suggests bacteria in our gut microbiome may be responsible. This program of work will allow us to understand how gut bacteria modulate activity of the immune system in response to vaccination. This knowledge will be crucial to both future vaccine development and improving vaccines currently in use."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017405^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017405"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Better health outcomes after road traffic injury
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Chronic pain is the leading cause of disability worldwide with 30% caused by a road traffic injury. My research will produce new knowledge under three aims. To: 1) Gain new insights into the development of chronic pain
column3: 2) Test novel early treatments to prevent chronic pain after road traffic injury and 3) Implement early risk-screening models of care in the clinical and injury compensation environments. The outcomes will drive change in the assessment and treatment of road traffic injury."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017417^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017417"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Applying communication and social science to improve vaccine confidence and uptake
column2: Investigator Grants"^"COVID-19 has put vaccination in the spotlight like never before. It is more important than ever to understand why some people don't vaccinate and what to do about it. This research will: 1) Use surveys to understand access and acceptance barriers to vaccination
column3: and 2) Provide tools and training for community leaders to use to advocate for vaccination. The outcome will be to help more people feel comfortable about getting routine and COVID-19 vaccines in Australia and the Western Pacific Region."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017420^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017420"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Targeting T cell differentiation and function to treat cancer and chronic disease
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Chronic diseases
column3: including persistent viral infections and cancer
column4: are major health burdens and among the most difficult to treat. T cells play a central role in disease control; however
column5: their function is often impaired by a process termed ‘exhaustion’. Immunotherapies aimed at reinvigorating exhausted T cells have revolutionised cancer treatment. In this project
column6: I will identify molecular pathways that control T cells with the goal to pave the way for new immunotherapies for chronic diseases."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017436^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017436"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Addressing the threat of emerging zoonotic malaria in our region
column2: Investigator Grants"^"The monkey malaria parasite P. knowlesi (Pk) increasingly infects humans across Southeast Asia. A multidisciplinary approach will evaluate why Pk cases are rising
column3: improve laboratory detection methods
column4: assess preventative treatments
column5: and inform public health programs. Pk genetic analyses will explore causes of severe disease and geographical infection patterns. Evaluating human interaction with mosquitos
column6: monkeys
column7: and land-use
column8: will generate regional Pk risk prediction maps for targeted control."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017438^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017438"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Innovative interventions to reduce the personal and societal burden of food allergy
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Food allergy causes severely reduced quality of life and psychological distress for allergic children and their families. My vision is to free children and families from the burdens of living with food allergy. This 5 year program of research will: (i) identify and evaluate new treatments that induce remission of allergy
column3: bringing a long-term solution that will transform the lives of allergic children and families; (ii) deliver innovative tools that improve the way food allergy is managed now."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017450^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017450"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving equity
column2: access
column3: and quality of cardiac rehabilitation services
column4: Investigator Grants"^"Cardiac rehabilitation (CR) enables people who have suffered a heart event to self-manage their condition and improve their quality of life.However
column5: many eligible patients (70%) do not attend. Telehealth-delivered CR can reduce access barriers
column6: is safe
column7: effective and is well-liked by patients. However
column8: there is a practice-gap in translating these findings into practice. This project aims to provide a major health system impact by supporting the expanded use of telehealth across CR services."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017461^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017461"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"New Toxin Tools for Dissecting Pain
column2: Investigator Grants"^"There is worldwide demand for new and creative pain treatment strategies. The aim of my research is to identify new pain-causing toxins from animal venoms and to use them as tools to improve our understanding and
column3: ultimately treatment

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017463^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017463"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Novel approaches to understand and treat human allergic diseases
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Allergic diseases affect ~1 in 3 Australians and carry significant health and financial burdens. Primary immunodeficiencies (PIDs) result from damaging mutations in genes that affect the development and function of immune cells. In addition to life-threatening infections
column3: PID patients often suffer from severe allergies. I will investigate immune cells from PID patients and patients with allergy to reveal mechanisms of disease and novel approaches to understand and treat these conditions."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017476^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017476"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Prolonging survival in glioblastoma through targeting of quiescent glioma stem cells.
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Most people diagnosed with the brain cancer glioblastoma die within 15-months. The cancer is so deadly because of slowly dividing cancer stem cells that resist treatment and cause patient relapse. My strategy is to eliminate these resistant cells by focusing on unique features of their biology
column3: for example
column4: by targeting the fact that these cells have increased expression of surface proteins. This project will test targeted molecules to establish an evidence base for Phase 1 trials."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017477^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017477"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"An immunogenomic approach to breast cancer in young women
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Breast cancer causes the highest number of disease related deaths in adult women under the age of 45. It is a difficult problem that is also becoming more common. To understand this disease better
column3: we need a comprehensive and detailed approach. Using samples taken from real patients
column4: we will apply the most sophisticated technologies available to us for revealing how and why a cancer develops. This will ultimately lead to better ways to treat
column5: detect and prevent breast cancer in young women."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017479^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017479"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Transforming Outcomes for Pulmonary Fibrosis
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Pulmonary Fibrosis (PF) is a group of devastating conditions with scarring of the lung tissue - the most common has a survival of only 2-5 years. This research program will develop new techniques to understand the causes of PF; improve early and accurate diagnosis; correctly identify patients whose PF is more likely to progress rapidly
column3: and those most likely to respond to treatment; and optimise delivery of PF care across Australia. This will enable more personalised approaches to treatment."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017481^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017481"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"The impact of chronic viral infections on molecular ageing processes and associated clinical outcomes
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Older people with certain chronic virus infections age more quickly and have more ageing-related medical problems than people without chronic virus infections. This research will study key chronic virus infections – HIV and cytomegalovirus (a very common virus) – to better understand the biological processes that increase the risk of ageing-related medical conditions. The aim of this research is to discover novel screening and prevention measures to promote healthy ageing."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017485^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017485"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Eliminating Malaria in the Asia-Pacific
column2: Investigator Grants"^"In the Asia-Pacific
column3: more than two billion people are at risk of malaria
column4: a parasitic disease transmitted by mosquitoes. I will work with malaria endemic partners to provide evidence for the most effective malaria prevention strategies and improve surveillance so that every last malaria infection is detected
column5: treated and eliminated. My program aims to change policy and advance progress towards the goal of malaria elimination in the Asia-Pacific by 2030."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017498^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017498"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"A program of substantive and methodological research and capacity building in biostatistics
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Adaptive platform designs are revolutionising how clinical trials are conducted. The proposed program of biostatistical and substantive research and capacity building in these study designs will not only lead to advances in statistical methodology and child health
column3: but will ensure that Australia has the biostatistical skills and understanding to support cutting-edge clinical and public health research into the future."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017499^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017499"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Single molecular antigen rapid test (SMART)
column2: Investigator Grants"^"This project aims to investigate the role of the spike protein of the COVID-19 virus in binding antibodies and host cells. The project will use new knowledge to develop a Single Molecular Antigen Rapid Test (SMART). Expected outcomes include a better understanding of virus functions and their structural correlation at the molecular level
column3: being able to visualise spike-induced cellular interactions
column4: and a device that can detect multiple virus antigens
column5: sensitively and very efficiently."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017504^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017504"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Novel approaches to improve blood pressure control
column2: Investigator Grants"^"High blood pressure (BP) is the top killer of people in Australia
column3: but only 1 in 3 adults with high BP has it under control. My vision is to rapidly improve BP control using four novel scalable approaches. My program will evaluate the effectiveness of highly promising interventions to lower BP: a salt substitute; a BP awareness campaign in hardware stores; using wearable cuffless BP monitoring; and a simplified treatment model with single pill combination therapy in primary care."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017506^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017506"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Protecting physical & mental health of trauma-exposed populations
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Traumatic experiences are a risk factor for poor physical and mental health. This research program will generate critical knowledge on how lifestyle factors (physical activity
column3: diet and sleep) impact mental and physical health
column4: in people exposed to trauma. This includes emergency service workers
column5: veterans and people from refugee and asylum seeker backgrounds. Results will inform how lifestyle programs can be integrated into routine care of people exposed to trauma (with
column6: and at risk of PTSD)."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017515^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017515"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Multi-omic landscape of platelet function in disease
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Platelets enable blood clotting and would healing during vascular injury requiring high levels of energy to be maintained during circulation in preparation for activation. The energy centre of the cell is packaged within platelets but its function is not well defined. This project will uncover how dysfunction in the energy centre affects the platelets and how this can be translated to diagnosis and treatments for patients with excessive bleeding or clotting leading to stroke or heart attack."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017517^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017517"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"New method to identify disease-associated drug targets
column2: Investigator Grants"^"This project aims to develop mass spectrometry-based methods to identify or characterise new targets for drug discovery. The application of the methods in target identification will allow finding of unknown protein targets for bioactive compounds and will revolutionise and dramatically accelerate the drug discovery process. Furthermore
column3: adapting to studying membrane proteins will result in finding novel therapeutic ligands that target MPs
column4: the most important class of drug targets."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017521^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017521"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Targeting anhedonia to improve clinical and functional outcomes in depression
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Anhedonia (loss of pleasure) is a key driver of disability in people with depression because it impairs functioning and responds poorly to treatment. This research aims to improve our understanding of anhedonia’s underlying causes and will evaluate whether a novel intervention improves symptoms and functioning for people with anhedonic depression. By informing new treatment approaches for anhedonia
column3: the findings would make significant progress toward reducing the global burden of depression."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017527^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017527"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Next Generation Therapeutic Brain Stimulation for Depression and beyond
column2: Investigator Grants"^"With millions of people suffering from depression and other mental illnesses
column3: there is an urgent need for more effective treatments. I aspire to make possible a future in which dysfunctional brain circuits are routinely delineated using a person’s brain scans and treated using innovative brain stimulation therapeutics. My program will fundamentally advance the brain stimulation personalisation technology that I have developed and accelerate its clinical translation to improve patient outcomes."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017537^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017537"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Averting suicide contagion and suicide clusters in young people
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Suicide is the leading cause of death in young Australians. Young people who are exposed to suicide are at significant risk of suicide themselves. The proposed research will transform suicide prevention policy by building the evidence base identifying who is at risk of suicide contagion and clusters and building a suite of practical resources that can be implemented and utilised by stakeholders and decision makers to avert further deaths in communities impacted by multiple suicide losses."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017538^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017538"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving outcomes after high-risk surgery
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Complications after operations are common and can result in chronic health problems or death. In this project
column3: a large clinical trial will test whether treatment with a local anaesthetic drug
column4: lidocaine
column5: reduces the development of chronic pain one year after high-risk breast cancer surgery. Parallel studies will also assess the impact of enhanced ward monitoring after all types of high-risk operations and the role of inflammation in driving poor surgical outcomes."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017575^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017575"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Scalable Survivorship Support after Cancer (CanSupport): Evaluation of a co-designed and automated eHealth intervention to support cancer survivors in primary care
column2: Investigator Grants"^"After cancer treatment
column3: survivors need ongoing health support but access is limited. As an emerging survivorship researcher
column4: my vision is to improve survivors’ access to support and health. I will expand my earlier breast cancer work to co-design a new support program for prostate
column5: colorectal and lung cancer survivors sent via text messages called CanSupport
column6: test if it improves support access and health in a primary care clinical trial and collect information to inform national roll-out."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017578^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017578"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Structural biology and protein engineering to accelerate rational development of novel antipsychotics
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Schizophrenia is a debilitating psychiatric disorder that affects ~1% of the population
column3: with a projected global economic burden of ~US$6trillion by 2030. Unfortunately
column4: most schizophrenia patients discontinue antipsychotic treatment within the initial months of starting due to two key reasons: debilitating side effects and lack of efficacy. My research program is focused on solving these major bottlenecks with cutting-edge techniques and platforms for drug discovery at both new and old targets."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017580^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017580"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving sepsis outcomes using precision medicine
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Sepsis occurs when your body’s response to infection damages its own tissues and organs
column3: if not prevented or treated promptly it may be fatal. It affects 55
column4: 000 Australians each year causing 7
column5: 000 deaths. Survivors commonly suffer long term health problems. My research focusses on improving the design and conduct of clinical trials that will match the right treatments to the right patients at the right time thus reducing death and disability from sepsis."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017583^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017583"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Fair resource allocation decisions in old age – enhancing the quality-adjusted life year (QALY) framework
column2: Investigator Grants"^"People aged 65 years and over
column3: a rapidly growing age group
column4: are significant users of health and aged care services. Funding decisions for services are guided by cost-effectiveness evidence
column5: using quality-adjusted life years (QALYs) as a measure of effectiveness. Yet the methods used to derive QALYs in older adults are flawed. My research will provide evidence on how to improve the estimation of QALYs in older adults
column6: promoting fairer and socially accepted funding decisions for older adults."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017605^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017605"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving Emergency Department Identification and Care for Children with Sepsis
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Sepsis is a severe infection of major national concern due to its morbidity and mortality. Early identification and optimal management of children at risk of sepsis in emergency departments are yet to be determined. My program will develop methods to identify these children
column3: expand our understanding of sepsis causes and identify the most efficacious intravenous fluid for management. The goal is to improve sepsis care for children by filling evidence gaps for national/international guidelines."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017609^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017609"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Integration of Pre-hospital and Hospital cardiac clinical registries to investigate novel therapeutics and systems of care in cardiac emergencies
column2: Investigator Grants"^"The cardiac emergencies of cardiac arrest and heart attack continue to be a major challenge
column3: with unacceptably high mortality and morbidity. Best outcomes are seen when systems of care integrating pre-hospital and hospital care are optimized. My research team involves the collaboration of Ambulance Victoria
column4: with hospital based cardiac clinical registries
column5: allowing for the unique opportunity to perform pragmatic clinical trials
column6: to improve therapies in patients who currently have poor outcomes."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017628^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017628"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Targeting death anxiety with an online intervention to improve outcomes in anxiety-related disorders
column2: Investigator Grants"^"High rates of anxiety disorders are a global issue
column3: with dire need for scalable treatment. Death anxiety has been shown to underpin many anxiety-related disorders
column4: making it a vital treatment target. This research program will examine the world's first online evidence-based intervention for death anxiety. It will provide evidence of whether interventions targeting death anxiety improve existing mental health symptoms
column5: reduce relapse
column6: and prevent development of new disorders."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017630^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017630"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Innovative public health strategies for the elimination of malaria and lymphatic filariasis
column2: Investigator Grants"^"My vision is to improve the health of communities that have a high
column3: yet often unrecognised
column4: burden of parasitic vector-borne diseases
column5: particularly malaria and lymphatic filariasis. My collaborative program of research will reduce the burden of these chronic debilitating infections in low-income countries
column6: especially Papua New Guinea
column7: by developing and testing new public health strategies and directly informing policy to target these infections more accurately
column8: efficiently and effectively."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017642^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017642"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Digital health to support behaviour change and chronic disease prevention in the community: What works
column2: for whom
column3: and in what context?
column4: Investigator Grants"^"The use of technology like apps to support health care and lifestyle behaviours is becoming increasingly common. However
column5: the research to date is either non-existent or unclear as to which ones work best to improve health outcomes. I will address this gap by synthesising existing research and evaluating novel technologies such as artificial intelligence to better understand how digital technologies can be best used to improve health behaviours and prevent chronic disease in the community."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017646^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017646"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Novel approaches to the treatment and monitoring of patients with incurable haematological cancers
column2: Investigator Grants"^"This project will focus on 2 largely incurable forms of blood cancer; T cell lymphoma (TCL) and acute myeloid leukemia (AML). We will join international collaborators contributing to large databases to examine the causes and predictors of outcome of TCL. I will undertake completely novel clinical trials using non-chemotherapy therapies which will include the scale-up in our laboratory of genetically engineered human immune cells called CART cells specifically designed for treating TCL and AML."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017651^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017651"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Translating Epilepsy Genetics Advances into Improved Patient Care
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Many epilepsies are now known to be genetic. The time has come to use this knowledge in the management of people with epilepsy to improve their treatment outcomes. I will develop a research program that will translate the progress in epilepsy genetics in the past 20 years into better patient care by using genetic data to accurately classify epilepsies of unknown type and guide epilepsy surgery. I will also set up a platform to study therapies targeting genetic abnormalities causing epilepsy."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017661^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017661"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Optimised Outpatient Parenteral Antimicrobial Therapy
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Treatment of many complicated infections can now occur in the community rather than hospital. The approach of giving antibiotics in the home setting is preferred by patients and health services. However
column3: practical challenges impact on which antibiotics are available for use in the home setting. Further
column4: as this is a relatively new field
column5: research on the best possible treatments and strategies to overcome practical challenges to antibiotic administration in the home setting are urgently needed."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017679^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017679"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Platform Technologies for Antibiotic Resistance Diagnostics at Single-Cell Resolution
column2: Investigator Grants"^"My research aims to advance our understanding of antibiotic resistance in bacterial populations at the single-cell level. Examining the differences between individual bacterial cells in response to antibiotics is essential to provide fundamental insights into heterogeneous resistance
column3: an important player precipitating the antibiotic crisis. Expected outcomes include improved knowledge of bacterial heterogeneity
column4: informing antibiotic usage
column5: and a new tool for more accurate resistance testing."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017694^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017694"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Design and evaluation of novel interventions for infectious diseases of global importance
column2: Investigator Grants"^"I will set up a new centre to conduct studies on how to prevent sexually transmitted infections and neglected tropical diseases in the countries most affected by these conditions. I will trial novel uses and new agents for mass drug administration
column3: which involves treating whole populations when disease rates are high
column4: rather than trying to find those with the infection. I will also evaluate innovative methods for tracking the impact of programs and strategies aimed at control of these diseases."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017719^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017719"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Transforming Injury for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Children through Innovative Knowledge Gain and Co-designed Intervention
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Indigenous children have high rates of injury
column3: these rates are not decreasing and create burden in the community. My research program will address this through collaborating with Indigenous communities in South Australia and working with Big Data to understand the injury burden for Indigenous children
column4: detect areas for improvement
column5: and co-design an injury intervention for Indigenous children to decrease injury and improve health and wellbeing."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017734^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017734"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Lungs for life: a programme of clinical trials to improve respiratory outcomes for premature babies
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Almost 1 in 10 babies in Australia are born early (preterm). They often need help to breathe at birth
column3: and for days and weeks afterwards. Some will go on to have long-term problems with their lungs. My research looks at how we can improve the outlook for preterm babies
column4: by finding better ways to support their breathing
column5: right from their first breath. Improving how we care for preterm babies immediately after birth can improve their lung health
column6: as newborns
column7: as children and through to adulthood."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017742^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017742"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Large scale evidence
column2: microsimulation and translation to address contemporary challenges in tobacco control and cardiovascular disease
column3: Investigator Grants"^"Chronic diseases
column4: including cardiovascular disease (CVD)
column5: cancer
column6: dementia
column7: chronic kidney disease and chronic lung disease
column8: are highly preventable and threaten Australia's continuing improvements in life expectancy. The proposed research will generate and translate large-scale evidence to drive improvement in tobacco control
column10: for the general and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander populations
column11: including through creation of an enduring CVD microsimulation model."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017774^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017774"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Advanced intravascular optical imaging in vivo for future precise diagnosis and treatment therapies
column2: Investigator Grants"^"This interdisciplinary project aims to develop a new optical imaging modality using the high-speed and focus-tunable micro-lenses I recently invented. The device will be small enough to be inserted into blood vessels to provide high-quality images with unprecedented resolution and image depth. Artificial intelligence will be implemented for high-speed and real-time image processing. This will help specialists better visualise and understand the causes of heart attacks and how to prevent them."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017798^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017798"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Managing the First Pillar for Atrial Fibrillation and Stroke
column2: Investigator Grants"^"This program will develop and evaluate a standardised approach to the management of lifestyle/risk factors for atrial fibrillation (AF) and stroke. Management of AF is currently not standardised and therefore leads to highly variable patient outcomes. Advancing risk factor modification as the primary AF management pillar
column3: this program seeks to establish a new paradigm of upstream interventions for the prevention and treatment of AF and stroke
column4: and formulate optimal delivery strategies for care."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017818^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017818"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"A holistic approach to achieving best health outcomes through culturally appropriate self-determined pathways into employment for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people
column2: Investigator Grants"^"This project will achieve best health outcomes for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples by developing holistic culturally appropriate pathways into self-determined employment. The longer people remain unemployed the more likely they suffer from a range of health problems and premature deaths. By improving employment outcomes
column3: we will improve the set of circumstances that individuals
column4: families
column5: and communities are born
column6: grow
column7: live and work. This will promote good health and wellbeing."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017828^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017828"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Turning the tide: co-developing drowning prevention interventions
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Drowning is a leading cause of injury deaths. In the last 30 years
column3: we have developed a good understanding of how we can prevent drowning incidents and deaths
column4: but we have not implemented our knowledge to its full potential. Using robust methods and through a consultative process
column5: I will work with communities and policy stakeholders in Australia and India to develop and implement
column6: evidence-led drowning prevention solutions for populations most susceptible to drowning."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017844^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017844"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Understanding and reducing hip osteoarthritis burden in young adults and adolescents
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Hip pain is common in young adults
column3: causing substantial burden and representing early hip arthritis. My research program will reduce the burden of hip pain in younger adults at risk of/with early hip arthritis. I will capture the natural history of hip disease and develop effective interventions
column4: determining how to best treat hip pain in younger adult
column5: and identify who is at risk of hip arthritis to stop the progression of hip pain to hip osteoarthritis and the need for hip replacement."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017876^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017876"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Harnessing innovative digital technologies to enhance youth mental health care
column2: Investigator Grants"^"There is a growing youth mental health crisis. Mental ill-health remains the leading cause of death in young people. Of the one in four who suffer
column3: only a quarter receive adequate care. To overcome this crisis
column4: more accessible and effective treatments need to be developed. My research program will develop
column5: evaluate and implement a new generation of treatments that harness advanced digital technologies to provide better care to young people."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017877^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017877"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Targeted regulatory T cells to treat autoimmune diseases
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Autoimmune diseases occur when the immune system attacks a person's own body. These diseases affect more than a million Australians and hundreds of millions worldwide. There are no cures and current treatments cause significant side effects. This novel research program will use genetic engineering to develop a potent cell-based therapy that specifically treats the cause of disease. This new therapy has the potential to cure autoimmune diseases and restore the lives of many patients."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017879^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017879"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving outcomes for children with anxiety disorders
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Children whose mental health difficulties are identified early
column3: and effectively addressed
column4: reap the benefits across their lifespan. This has profound benefits for the child and the child’s family as well as significant social benefits. We need to invest in improving outcomes for children with anxiety to make an enduring difference to the mental health of all Australians. This work will improve access to
column5: and delivery of evidence-based care and will improve treatments for children with anxiety."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017897^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017897"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Translating new therapeutics and diagnostics for stillbirth and preeclampsia
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Stillbirth and preeclampsia are terrible diseases of pregnancy that can claim the life of the mother
column3: or her unborn baby. Here
column4: I propose large programs of research that will avidly hunt for new treatments and diagnostics to tackle both conditions. We will develop a blood test that may save babies from stillbirth. We will find new drugs in the laboratory to treat preeclampsia and test them in successive international clinical trials - mainly South Africa where the disease is sadly rife."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017898^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017898"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Novel Therapeutic Strategies for Childhood Brain Cancer
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Brain cancer is the single disease causing the most deaths in childhood
column3: as well as significant disability and long-term health problems for survivors
column4: warranting urgent improvement to treatments. My program seeks to improve outcomes for children with the most aggressive brain tumours by developing new targeted treatment strategies
column5: investigating immunotherapies
column6: and developing strategies to allow effective drugs to penetrate into the brain."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017903^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017903"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Harnessing novel lymph-resident targets and lymph-specific therapeutics to fight inflammation
column2: Investigator Grants"^"The mesenteric lymphatic system plays vital roles in regulating dietary lipid transport and immune activation. Lymphatic dysfunction impairs these processes
column3: and is detrimental in both obesity-associated metabolic disease and inflammatory bowel disease. This proposal will uncover the mechanisms driving mesenteric lymphatic dysfunction and associated inflammation. This knowledge will be used to establish lymph-specific therapeutics to enhance treatment outcomes in chronic inflammation."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017912^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017912"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Linking microbiome
column2: inflammation
column3: HIV target cells
column4: Investigator Grants"^"New HIV infections are now clearly associated with an inflamed genital tract (in both females and males) and the microbiome of these sites. What is unclear is the immune cell constitution of these inflamed tissues that may be the main drivers of increased disease. I have developed in my lab techniques to isolate and interrogate immune cells from human genital tissue and how they interact with HIV. I will connect the immune cell environment with inflammation and the microbiome."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017916^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017916"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Tumour-stroma crosstalk in breast cancer: Deciphering and disrupting communications between cancer cells and cancer-associated fibroblasts
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Breast cancer can be described as a play with many acts and actors. For approx. 20% of women diagnosed with this disease
column3: there are no targeted therapies and for many more
column4: recurrence and metastasis are major obstacles. Whilst tumour cells take centre stage in the diagnosis and treatment of this disease
column5: it is now understood that fibroblasts play an important supporting role. Using novel methods to view and study this disease
column6: my work will help to define the next generation of cancer therapies."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017929^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017929"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Investigating the interplay between cell death and inflammation in human diseases
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Cell death is a mechanism that allows old cells to be replaced by new cells or occurs during tissue damage. In some contexts
column3: dying cells release inflammatory molecules that can be beneficial or detrimental to the body. This proposal aims to study the complex interplay between cell death and inflammation. Understanding the involvement of these processes in cancer and inflammatory diseases is essential to identify novel treatment strategies."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017942^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017942"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Developing and Applying Mendelian Randomization Methods to Facilitate Drug Discovery and Solve Intractable Problems in Medical Research
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Mendelian randomization is a way of using genetic data to test whether particular environmental exposures
column3: biological molecules or drug targets cause disease. The purpose of this Investigator Award is to create new statistical methods and software that use Mendelian randomization to facilitate drug discovery
column4: and to use the Mendelian randomization paradigm to solve high value questions in medical research that have so far proven intractable to other research approaches."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017952^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017952"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Innovating pathways to embed novel RNA technologies into clinical practise
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Genetic rare disorders affect 1 in 100 individuals. A precise genetic diagnosis is the key to personalised healthcare
column3: disease prevention
column4: and sometimes a cure or treatment. For the 50% of families undiagnosed after DNA testing
column5: the answer can lie in their RNA. I will lead an evidence-based national strategy to embed RNA diagnostics in clinical practise
column6: vastly improving diagnoses of families living with genetic rare disorders and revolutionising their personalised health care options."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017962^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017962"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Identifying clinically relevant neurobiological markers of depression and suicidal behaviours
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Depression and suicide have a devastating impact on lives and communities. To develop more effective treatments
column3: we need to gain a better understanding of the biological mechanisms underlying depression and suicide. This research program aims to identify brain markers that can assist in the diagnosis of depression and suicidal thoughts and behaviours and predict who is at risk for poor clinical outcomes over time."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017971^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017971"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Using advanced CRISPR tools to improve clinical therapies for poor prognostic lymphomas
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Treatment outcomes for certain aggressive blood cancers have not improved in recent years. Many patients do not respond and novel treatments are desperately required. My program aims to fill this gap by using sophisticated lymphoma models and unique molecular tools to discover new treatments and therapy resistance factors
column3: and to test a new drug for clinical application. Outcomes of this work could improve life quality and chances for a cure for blood cancer patients."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017974^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2017974"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Fighting Cancer Relapse: Developing an Oral Cancer Vaccine Generating Memory T Cells
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Colorectal cancer (CRC) is the world's second most fatal cancer with a high rate of relapse. This project aims to develop an oral vaccine for preventing CRC recurrence by boosting the local gut immune response
column3: which is at the frontline in powerful anti-cancer defence. This oral vaccine is based on cutting-edge research in immunology and nanomaterials
column4: enabling robust and persistent protection against CRC recurrence
column5: and enables convenient oral intake for maximal patient acceptance."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018015^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018015"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Increasing the impact of food policy research in Australia and globally
column2: Investigator Grants"^"My research will identify the critical factors required to support adoption and implementation of food policies by governments in Australia and globally. It will inform strategies to support researchers to strengthen the impact of future food policy research. This will ensure that evidence-based policies are to improve diets are adopted and implemented reducing the health and economic burden of diet-related diseases and meaning government funding for food policy research is well spent."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018064^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018064"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Advancing perinatal health in Australia through international randomised studies to reduce death and disability.
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Clinical trials have made big advances in treatment in all areas in Australia and worldwide. However most trials for high-risk babies and their mothers are too small to find improvements in healthy survival as quickly as we would like. We will work with stakeholders across the world to create a new kind of trial that will run at least ten times larger and faster
column3: at one tenth the cost
column4: saving thousands more lives and millions more dollars in Australia and overseas"^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018071^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018071"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Early intervention for therapeutic benefit in AML: a national program of clinical trials
column2: Investigator Grants"^"AML is a lethal blood cancer capable of developing resistance to therapy. Relapsing disease is the major barrier to improving outcome. I will build on my success in delivering new AML therapies by developing a national program of trials using technologies to detect returning disease at its earliest stages complemented by novel drugs to target AML with precision intent. A multidisciplinary team will elucidate mechanisms of resistance and validate alternative approaches to extend patient survival."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018077^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018077"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Saving lives with better blood pressure measurement
column2: Investigator Grants"^"The research program aims to address problems related to inaccurate measurement of blood pressure (BP). I will use advanced analysis techniques to develop a better way to measure BP. Other program elements include examining the accuracy of BP measurement in high-risk patients and promotion best practice measurement methods and devices through translational research. Overall
column3: the aim of the program is to minimise the burden of preventable cardiovascular disease in Australia and globally."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018081^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018081"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"New therapies for skeletal dysplasia
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Inherited disorders of the skeleton are common with significant health impacts. My research has enabled treatment of these conditions at their genetic source. This program will assess whether drug treatment of infants with achondroplasia will decrease the 50-fold higher risk of sudden death by relieving pressure on the spinal cord
column3: and assess whether treatment of children with metaphyseal dysplasia will relieve pain
column4: improve skeletal deformity and eliminate the need for invasive surgery."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018082^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018082"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Estimating the health equity and productivity impacts of dietary salt reduction in people with chronic kidney disease in Australia
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Excess salt intake increases blood pressure and puts persons at risk of complications like chronic kidney disease (CKD) that kills one in ten Australians. CKD contributes to health inequalities and has a major impact on quality of life and productivity
column3: and the future impacts in Australia are unknown. This project will evaluate long-term impacts of strategies to reduce population salt intake on CKD burden
column4: to guide policies that improve the quality of life of all Australians."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018098^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018098"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Understanding and exploiting A-to-I RNA editing
column2: Investigator Grants"^"This project will determine how changes to a type of RNA modification
column3: termed Adenosine-to-Inosine (A-to-I) RNA editing
