column4: cause disease. Reduced A-to-I editing causes development of autoimmune disease and brain diseases. Too much editing is seen in cancer. I will use animal models to understand how changes in A-to-I editing cause disease. This will be important to provide knowledge of how these diseases occur and identify new ways to treat them."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018101^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018101"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Scaling the effects of salt substitute on cardiovascular risk reduction population-wide
column2: Investigator Grants"^"In a world-first trial
column3: we showed that switching regular salt for a reduced-sodium
column4: added-potassium ‘salt substitute’ can lower blood pressure and prevent premature death. ‘Salt substitutes’ are safe and low-cost but are not widely used. Over the next 5-years I will do the work required to upscale their use in Australia and around the world. I will do this by building tools that show governments the health gains
column5: cost-benefits and practical ways they can scale national uptake of salt substitute."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018105^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018105"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Decoding the instructions for immune cell function
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Each organ sends many different signals to its immune cells to instruct them in varied and critical functions that impact health and disease. These signals are complex and there is a lack of tools to study them
column3: so how they act to instruct immune cell function remains largely unknown. I will combine cutting-edge molecular and imaging technologies to discover how the breast instructs its immune cells and reveal new ways to control breast cancer
column4: treat inflammation and improve infant health."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018108^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018108"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Harnessing big data to improve access to care and outcomes in REcent Migrants And Refugees diagnosed with Cancer (REMARC)
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Cancer is one of the leading causes of death in Australia. There have been 4.5 million migrants and refugees to Australia in the last 30 years. This research program uses big data to study whether recent migrants and refugees diagnosed with cancer access the right treatments and the impacts of a cancer diagnosis on these people’s lifespan and employment. Our research will highlight current gaps and the policy changes needed to improve the lives of people diagnosed with cancer in this population."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018114^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018114"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Investigating the epigenetic control of female-biased autoimmune disorders
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Our immune system is a complex network of cells that defend us from infections. In 5-8% of people
column3: the immune system goes awry and mistakenly attacks the body’s healthy tissues
column4: leading to autoimmune disease. Remarkably
column5: 80% of autoimmunity patients are women
column6: however
column7: the molecular mechanisms behind this bias remain unknown. Using cutting-edge technologies
column8: I will define female-specific mechanisms leading to autoimmunity
column9: which will provide tools for diagnostics and drug target prioritisation."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018118^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018118"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Food
column2: mood and microbes: Improving mental health through diet
column3: Investigator Grants"^"Mental health conditions like depression are a major cause of reduced quality of life. Unfortunately
column4: medications are suboptimal for many people with the condition. Research shows changing your diet can improve depression. A Mediterranean diet rich in wholegrain cereals
column5: fruit
column6: vegetables and olive oil is particularly beneficial. However
column7: we do not know how this diet improves depression symptoms and we need to identify ways to provide clear information about it to the people who need it most."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018144^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018144"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Driving change in the health sector to reduce the impact of intergenerational trauma and family violence
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Intergenerational trauma and family violence are global public health issues with major impacts on the health and wellbeing of children
column3: families and communities. My research will provide robust evidence about lived experiences of intergenerational trauma and family violence in priority populations to inform early intervention and health system reform. Co-designed intervention studies will provide evidence about ways to embed culturally safe
column4: trauma-informed approaches into practice."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018157^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018157"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Harnessing digital technologies to improve the quality of youth mental health services
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Mental disorders are the leading cause of disability and death among young people. While youth mental health services have improved access to care
column3: many challenges contribute to ongoing service inefficiencies and poor clinical outcomes at high costs to society. This research program aims to address these challenges by making use of modern digital technologies to provide services with decision-support tools designed to make youth mental health care more personalised
column4: dynamic and proactive."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018163^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018163"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Atrial fibrillation: improving outcomes through lifestyle and ablation
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Atrial fibrillation(AF) is the most common heart rhythm disorder and an epidemic of cardiovascular disease. AF is associated with stroke
column3: mortality and heart failure. Ablation involves passing wires into the heart and delivering tiny burns to cure AF. Increasingly lifestyle factors such as weight loss and alcohol reduction have also been shown to reduce AF. The research plan explores yoga
column4: medicated weight loss and new ablation techniques to improve outcomes in people with AF."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018167^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018167"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Targeting crosstalk in the tumour microenvironment for precision cancer therapy
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Cancer spread remains very difficult to target therapeutically. My research focus has been modelling the cellular interactions that occur during cell spread to develop markers that predict the effectiveness of existing therapies and to uncover new biological targets for treating aggressive cancer types. I now aim to drive this research into the clinical setting by utilising unique humanised models and interrogating patient samples to enable science-guided therapies for cancer patients."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018182^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018182"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Musculoskeletal pain: getting the right patient to the right treatment at the right time
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Common painful conditions affecting the bones and joints such as low back pain and arthritis cause more disability than any other condition
column3: and the scale of the problem is rising. Health care is struggling to meet the demand
column4: commonly offering treatments of limited value to patients who don't need them
column5: whilst not providing access to effective care for those who do. This program will reduce uncertainty about treatment effectiveness and ensure patients get access to the care they need."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018187^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018187"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Leveraging liver-derived extracellular vesicles to identify new therapies for type 2 diabetes
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Type 2 diabetes is characterised by impairments in glycemic control
column3: compromised insulin secretion
column4: and insulin resistance. There is an urgent clinical need to develop new strategies to normalise blood glucose levels. This investigator grant aims to identify novel insulin-independent therapeutic targets that can improve glycemic control. This project will use preclinical models to validate the efficacy of these targets
column5: setting the stage for the development of new treatments for type 2 diabetes."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018194^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018194"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Innovative solutions towards reducing heart attacks- beyond classical risk factors
column2: Investigator Grants"^"I am a cardiologist driven by the increasing number of heart attack patients who ask “why me?”. Fourteen-27% of patients with life-threatening heart attacks have no standard modifiable risk factors. By focussing on this growing group with no risk factors
column3: I will discover and translate new biomarkers
column4: develop new drugs to reduce heart attacks
column5: derive new clinical pathways
column6: and improve outcomes with broader benefits to all patients susceptible to coronary artery disease and heart attack."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018204^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018204"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Advancing Refugee Mental Health
column2: Investigator Grants"^"The number of refugees worldwide has reached unprecedented levels. Refugees show high rates of psychological disorders due to exposure to war
column3: trauma and persecution. Despite this
column4: many do not seek help or fail to respond to treatment. This research program proposes to increase knowledge about the factors contributing to PTSD and help-seeking. This will lead to the development of two new interventions to improve mental health outcomes in refugees."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018214^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018214"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Reconstructing the megakaryocyte lipidome to control platelet production: Applications for thrombocytopenia or thrombocytosis
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Platelets are cell fragments critical for blood clotting. Too few
column3: results in bleeding disorders and too many
column4: can block blood supply to organs. Both are life threatening. Current treatments are limited and have side effects. There is an urgent need to identify new ways to counteract both extreme conditions. We recently identified important lipids that are needed for platelet production. Here
column5: we aim to increase or decrease these lipid levels to determine if we can control platelet production."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018220^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018220"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Optimizing strategies for control of neglected tropical diseases
column2: Investigator Grants"^"My research program will optimize strategies for control of neglected tropical diseases which are closely associated with poverty
column3: affecting 2 billion of people globally. The specific aims of this research program are: 1) optimising programs for control of intestinal worms; 2) integration of control programs to increase their impact and 3) defining the public health role of a new and promising medication
column4: moxidectin. Findings will be used to inform policy makers and improve existing guidelines."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018222^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018222"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Pathogen Genomics Dual Utility to Deliver Personalised Medicine and Precision Public Health
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Novel treatments for COVID-19 have rapidly been developed and are used to prevent severe SARS-CoV-2 infection in patients with underlying health conditions. The SARS-CoV-2 virus is evolving rapidly and this has led to variants that can reduce the effectiveness of novel antiviral treatments. This grant will develop genomic tools to predict the optimal SARS-CoV-2 therapeutic needed whilst monitoring for viral resistance in patients that fail antiviral therapy."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018244^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018244"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Leveraging genomics to unravel tumour complexity and improve patient outcomes
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Cancer is the cause of 1 in 8 deaths worldwide. Cancer occurs due to errors or mutations in the DNA of normal cells. I will identify the mutations in tumour cells to determine: i) How a tumour develops and how complex it is ii) How a tumour may be treated to kill the cancer The work studies a variety of cancer types including mesothelioma
column3: melanoma
column4: oesophageal and breast cancer. The overall vision is to apply some of the research findings or approaches into patient care to improve patient survival"^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018256^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018256"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"A rapid synthetic molecular evolution platform for novel antimicrobials against infections
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Infections caused by antimicrobial resistant bacteria are rapidly increasing worldwide
column3: with 106 million new cases annually. Antimicrobial peptides are a promising therapeutic to tackle the shortage of antibiotics. However
column4: conventional development of antimicrobial peptides is limited by inadequate preparation of large parallel libraries and ineffective bioactivity tests. I will develop novel approaches via computational modelling and smart synthesis to identify therapeutic to combat infections."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018340^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018340"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Breakthrough research paving the way for the development of transformative immunotherapies for SLE.
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Lupus is a debilitating autoimmune disease which is very hard to treat. Patients with lupus have a leaky gut but the role of this medical anomaly in driving disease is not known. Breakthrough data from our group showed that modifying the biology of immune cells in the gut
column3: restores gut health and protects against lupus. We propose to harness the biological mechanisms underpinning this new therapeutic effect for the development of transformative and much needed new therapies for lupus."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018360^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018360"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving the genetic diagnosis of cardiovascular disease
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Cardiovascular disease (CVD) claims 17.9 million lives each year and has remained the leading cause of death globally for the last 20 years. Using genomic technologies and novel computational methodology
column3: I will improve the rate of genetic diagnosis of cardiovascular disease and provide better understanding of the disease mechanism. This research program will enable personalised management and treatment
column4: and improved risk assessment for CVD patients and their families."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018363^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018363"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"RNA-level gene regulation
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Genetic information resides in the DNA of our genome; however
column3: to use this information it must be transcribed into chemically related RNA molecules
column4: collectively known as the transcriptome. While different body cells carry the same genome
column5: they differ widely in their transcriptome composition. To understand how cells properly utilise their transcriptomes
column6: I will characterise the marks and binding partners found on RNA in the context of cardiac and cancer biology."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018376^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018376"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Development of novel ablation technologies for the treatment of ventricular tachycardia
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Rhythm disorders from the main pumping chambers of the heart (ventricular arrhythmias
column3: VA) cause 1 in4 of all deaths from heart disease. VA can be treated effectively by finding and destroying the circuits within heart scar tissue that perpetuate VA (ablation). The study innovates new technology and minimally invasive approaches to reduce the risk of VA for patients with heart disease
column4: prolonging longevity and improving quality of life."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018383^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018383"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Simplified Immunotherapies for Global Oncology
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Around 1 in 5 cancers worldwide are caused by infections. These are particularly important in the developing world
column3: where they account for the majority of cancer cases and deaths
column4: often in young people. This grant continues my world-leading work in developing drugs to treat and prevent cancers caused by infections
column5: and in understanding their origins. I focus on simple but effective drugs that can be used in developing countries
column6: to ensure my new treatments can be used by those in greatest need."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018391^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018391"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Addressing unmet needs in chronic disease through innovations in trial design and delivery
column2: Investigator Grants"^"This program will utilise innovative designs and new digital capabilities to address some of the challenges in completing randomized trials in chronic disease. Trial designs will be informed by clinical practice and a good understanding of clinician and consumer attitudes to proposed trials. These approaches will facilitate large
column3: simple randomized quality assurance studies and trials embedded in clinical practice
column4: leading to improvements in clinical outcomes."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018420^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018420"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Expanding genetic causal inference analyses to evaluate cancer risk factors in diverse populations
column2: Investigator Grants"^"My research studies the use of statistical models applied to large-scale genetic data to help us understand what causes diseases such as cancers. Using these models
column3: I investigate whether the genetic background underlying cancers can give us clues about whether the observed relationship between a range of putatively modifiable risk factors and common cancers is causal in European populations. I am also investigating whether the same genetic relationship is present in other populations."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018431^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018431"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Towards improved clinical outcomes for common brain disorders using large-scale statistical genomics
column2: Investigator Grants"^"The social and economic costs of common brain disorders
column3: such as autism spectrum disorder and Parkinson’s disease
column4: are enormous. My research aims to generate new knowledge on these conditions by using advanced statistical methods to integrate large-scale genetics and genomics with deep clinical and lifestyle data. Ultimately
column5: this is expected to underpin improved clinical outcomes and quality of life through prevention
column6: earlier diagnosis
column7: and safer evidence-based treatments."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018432^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018432"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Characterisation of the genetic architecture of autoimmune disease at single-cell resolution
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Autoimmune disorders represent a considerable burden for the healthcare system
column3: affecting up to 9% of the human population. Genetic factors are the most significant contributors to autoimmune disease risk; however
column4: their effects on individual immune cells remain unknown. My research seeks to characterise the functional impact of genetic factors in pathological cell states and their role in mediating autoimmunity to ultimately improve the treatment of autoimmune conditions."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018440^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018440"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Dissecting the cellular ecosystems and therapeutic vulnerabilities of breast cancer
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Solid cancers are complex cellular ‘ecosystems’ in which the growth and drug response of the tumour is controlled by cell interactions. We will use single cell genomics to understand the nature and interactions of cells that make up breast cancers. This will help us to better understand the role of specific cell types in the development of cancers and find improved ways to treat cancer."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018461^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018461"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Engineering protein diagnostics/therapeutics via next-generation enzymatic and genetic code expansion approaches
column2: Investigator Grants"^"The use of protein conjugates for therapeutic or diagnostic applications is widespread. However
column3: currently employed protein modifying technologies are largely non-specific and result in a mixture of conjugates. It is difficult to predict how such mixtures perform in a clinical setting and typically a substantial fraction underperforms. To address these issues
column4: the proposed project aims to establish a platform for generating new types of highly defined protein conjugates."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018465^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018465"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Supporting healing and recovery for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander survivors of childhood sexual abuse
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Child sexual abuse is a form of violence that occurs across nations and cultures worldwide. Collective efforts are being made to address this issue within Victorian Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander communities. This research will generate new knowledge about survivors lived experiences of healing and recovery
column3: identify current therapeutic practices
column4: and build training and education resources that support Aboriginal organisations to better meet the healing and recovery needs of survivors."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018477^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018477"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Transforming Care and Outcomes for Patients with Pleural Effusion
column2: Investigator Grants"^"My world-leading program brings together clinicians
column3: scientists and allied health researchers to advance knowledge and care of pleural effusions (fluid build-up in the chest)
column4: a neglected condition that affects 60
column5: 000 Australians a year. Our consumer-driven research will use multicentre randomised trials
column6: multidisciplinary (diet
column7: exercise
column8: psychology) approaches and cutting-edge laboratory techniques to improve diagnosis and treatment of pleural effusions esp those from cancer and infection."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018497^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018497"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Microvascular dysfunction in acute ischemic stroke: The next frontier in stroke reperfusion
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Ischemic stroke is due to an abrupt blockage in a major brain artery. Over half of patients who receive acute treatment do not improve for unclear reasons. We will study how dysfunction of microcirculation (microscopic vessels in the brain) leads to complications and reduces treatment effectiveness. Ultimately
column3: the aim is to develop a new therapy targeting the microvessels that can augment the benefit of reperfusion treatments in stroke."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018514^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018514"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Melanoma: Getting the Diagnosis and Treatment Right for Better Patient Outcomes
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Melanoma is a major Australian health problem. Prevention
column3: early diagnosis and appropriate treatment remain the linchpins of disease control. Over the past decade
column4: new drug therapies have improved previously dismal outcomes for metastatic melanoma patients. This research proposal will integrate molecular and immune profiling with clinical and patient factors
column5: and personalised treatment strategies
column6: to transform melanoma diagnosis
column7: risk prediction and treatment across all stages of the disease."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018534^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018534"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Innovation for global lung health
column2: Investigator Grants"^"This program of work is dedicated to mitigating the global burden of ill-health due to lung disease. I have focused on the major respiratory diseases that are responsible for death and disability worldwide
column3: noncommunicable chronic respiratory disease (asthma and COPD) and tuberculosis
column4: and air pollution
column5: a major environmental cause of ill-health."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018537^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2018537"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Innovative clinical trials: improving care and health outcomes
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Ground-breaking clinical trials intended to advance care and improve health outcomes nationally and internationally will be undertaken. The focus will include trials and new methods in cardiovascular disease and diabetes particularly. Evidence synthesis for reliable guidelines and policy decisions will be conducted. Projects will link basic science research with clinical outcomes to improve our understanding of disease and treatment mechanisms."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015556^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015556"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Hearing loss
column2: the silent enemy of good health: Effectiveness
column3: cost-effectiveness
column4: and potential economic and social impact of interventions to promote treatment to facilitate improved hearing
column5: Targeted Call for Research"^"Hearing loss impacts many adults of all ages
column6: and 7 in 10 adults aged over 70 years. Despite significant associated health
column7: well-being and financial costs
column8: referrals for hearing care
column9: hearing aid adoption and use are very low. This project will identify barriers to medical referral for hearing care and barriers to hearing aid uptake and use and will design and evaluate the feasibility and cost-effectiveness of interventions to address these
column10: leading to improved health outcomes for Australians."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015700^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015700"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving access to the hearing services program for people from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds
column2: Targeted Call for Research"^"Hearing loss affects 1 in 5 people
column3: impacting communication
column4: quality of life
column5: education and employment
column6: social activities
column7: and physical and mental health. People can get effective help for hearing loss. But people from culturally and linguistically diverse communities are less likely to get help. We will work with people from culturally and linguistically diverse communities to co-design accessible
column8: equitable and culturally safe hearing services to preserve and protect hearing health."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015711^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015711"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Implementation and Evaluation of a Co-designed Program Targeting the Psychosocial and Emotional Impacts of Hearing Conditions in Adults
column2: Targeted Call for Research"^"Hearing conditions have many psychosocial consequences and the most common forms of management (e.g.
column3: hearing aids) do not appropriately address these concerns. This project will develop an online Hearing Wellbeing Program (HWP) to improve the psychological
column4: social
column5: and emotional wellbeing of people with hearing conditions. The project will test the feasibility of implementing the HWP and then assess the program for its effectiveness in improving the wellbeing of people with hearing conditions."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015735^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015735"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Building on newborn hearing screening success: towards national standards and data management
column2: Targeted Call for Research"^"Australia’s universal newborn hearing screening enables early hearing loss identification
column3: access to hearing devices and early intervention. But we do not know how hearing programs improve child outcomes
column4: who do not access services
column5: and whether postnatal screening occurs. We will establish the prerequisites of a national child hearing database to ensure screening/interventions improve child outcomes
column6: ensure no deaf or hard-of-hearing child ‘falls through the cracks’
column7: and facilitate research."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015748^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015748"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Empowering adults with hearing loss by increasing informed choice
column2: accessibility
column3: and uptake of hearing healthcare
column4: Targeted Call for Research"^"The problem. Four million Australians have hearing loss. Yet many do not seek help
column5: and are unaware of the hearing healthcare options that are available. This leads to many people not obtaining the hearing healthcare they need. Our solution. We will co-create a tailored online decision aid to explain the pros and cons of available hearing health options. We anticipate this approach to decision-making will increase uptake of hearing healthcare and improve the lives of many adults with hearing loss."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015750^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015750"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Prevalence of hearing loss in Aboriginal children caused by otitis media from birth to 5 years of age and evidence of the effectiveness of health promotion programs: evidence to inform national policy
column2: Targeted Call for Research"^"This project will provide the first estimates of the number of Aboriginal children who have ear infections and hearing loss from 0 to 5 years of age and will demonstrate the feasibility of screening for ear infections and hearing loss from 2 months of age. It will also test
column3: for the first time
column4: the effectiveness of a health promotion intervention to resolve ear infections and prevent hearing loss without the need for surgery. If effective
column5: this intervention can be implemented nationally."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015793^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015793"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Pathways For Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Hearing Health: The PATHWAY Project
column2: Targeted Call for Research"^"All children have the right to hear well
column3: but Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander children have inequitable access to hearing healthcare. Multifaceted strategies are needed which consider people’s first-hand experiences in the co-design of solutions. This project will generate evidence of culturally appropriate methods to build a strategy which optimises the complex and difficult to navigate hearing health patient pathway experienced by Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander children."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015794^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015794"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Hearables and behavioural activation for mental distress and social isolation in hearing impaired older adults
column2: Targeted Call for Research"^"Age-related hearing loss is common and may lead to depression
column3: social isolation
column4: loneliness
column5: and reduced quality of life. Hearing aids are expensive and simpler
column6: cost-effective hearing amplification devices (hearables) may offer an alternative treatment strategy. This trial will test if hearables in addition to a pragmatic psychological intervention (behavioural activation) improves mood
column7: quality of life
column8: mental distress and social isolation in older adults with mild to moderate hearing loss."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015803^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015803"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving the psychosocial and emotional well-being of adults with hearing loss through co-designed evidence-based services: ACE2.0
column2: Targeted Call for Research"^"Hearing loss affects a person’s ability to communicate and to socialise. Community members will partner with researchers to develop an innovative and contemporary education and support program to help adults with hearing loss and their family overcome the everyday communication
column3: social
column4: and emotional difficulties they experience. The solution will be rolled out and evaluated in hearing services across Australia and subsequently be made available to all Australians with hearing loss."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015740^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015740"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Bridge to Better Health: A Cluster Randomised Controlled Trial for Capacity Building in Intellectual Disability Health for General Practice
column2: Targeted Call for Research"^"We will improve preventive health outcomes for people with intellectual disability by supporting general practice nurses to do health assessments with their patients with intellectual disability. We will provide access to a specialist intellectual disability nurse
column3: training on conducting a health assessment
column4: intellectual disability health training and access to online resources. This intervention is designed to be able to be rolled out nationwide and will be evaluated using a randomised trial."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015753^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015753"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"GeneEQUAL: equitable and accessible genomic healthcare for people with intellectual disability
column2: Targeted Call for Research"^"The GeneEQUAL team are: • self-advocates • researchers • clinicians. We will talk with: • people with intellectual disability • their families • their doctors. We will ask them about genomic health care. Genomic health care is genetic tests and genetic counselling. We will write guides and resources so that genomic healthcare will: • include everyone respectfully • help people make healthcare choices • help people understand about their health conditions • help people get the right treatments and support."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015902^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015902"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Reducing potentially preventable hospitalisations and building health literacy for children and adolescents with intellectual disability
column2: Targeted Call for Research"^"Children with intellectual disability have high health care needs but access to primary care services can be hampered by difficulties they and their carers face day to day
column3: leading to potentially preventable hospitalisations. We will examine use of health services in hospital and primary care settings for these children
column4: the enablers and barriers to using primary care services
column5: and how health service use can be optimised for better care and be available across the community."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015929^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2015929"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Equitable access to health and disability services for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander children with intellectual disability
column2: Targeted Call for Research"^"This project will improve the health and wellbeing of Indigenous children with intellectual disability (ID) by recommending effective models of care to ensure appropriate
column3: timely diagnoses and access to high-quality health and disability services. National Disability Insurance Scheme data and interviews with families
column4: adolescents with ID
column5: and healthcare and disability services will be analysed to identify barriers and facilitators to meeting the healthcare needs of Indigenous children with ID."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2021932^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2021932"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Natural killer cell immunotherapy in paediatric sarcomas
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Sarcomas account for 10% of childhood cancers. It is a group of cancers arising from the bone or soft tissue with less than 30% chance of cure when it has spread or comes back despite intensive and possibly mutilating therapies. Natural killer (NK) cells are a type of immune cells known for their ability to kill cancer cells. This project aims to prove that our immune cells can be used to treat sarcomas by selecting the appropriate NK cells for the patients based on their receptor expression."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2021941^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2021941"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Overweight and obesity in young adults with type 1 and type 2 diabetes: mortality
column2: pregnancy outcomes
column3: and novel glycaemic interventions
column4: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"This project aims to explore the impact of overweight and obesity on long-term outcomes and pregnancy outcomes in young people with type 1 diabetes
column5: and to make comparisons with young-onset type 2 diabetes. Furthermore
column6: this project aims to produce highly novel randomised trial data on the efficacy of novel glycaemic and obesity interventions in people with overweight/obesity and type 1 dabetes/young-onset type 2 diabetes."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2021945^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2021945"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Evaluation and diagnosis of cardiac allograft vasculopathy post heart transplant using novel Cardiac CT techniques.
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Heart transplantation is reserved for patients with terminal heart failure. Cardiac allograft vasculopathy (CAV) is a leading cause of death post-transplant
column3: due to progressive narrowing in the heart arteries. As CAV is often asymptomatic
column4: screening with invasive coronary angiography (ICA) is required. Non-invasive testing with Cardiac CT may be a suitable alternative to ICA in this population
column5: and newer techniques examining the effect of blockages on blood flow may improve its accuracy."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2021950^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2021950"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"The ZEUs (ZopiclonE for acUte low back pain) trial: A multi-site
column2: double blind
column3: randomised controlled trial of zopiclone for acute low back pain
column4: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Low back pain (LBP) is the leading cause of disability globally and all commonly prescribed medications for acute LBP are not effective or cause serious side effects. Effective treatments for acute LBP are urgently needed. Muscle relaxants medicines such as Zopiclone
column5: a safe sleep drug
column6: appear to be safe and effective for acute LBP
column7: although considerable uncertainty remains. My study
column8: ZEUs
column10: double-blind placebo controlled randomised trial testing Zopiclone in acute LBP."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2021953^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2021953"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Ethics of cancer trials phD
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"This project seeks to understand how recent changes to the manner in which cancer research is designed and undertaken may influence the way research results are interpreted and used across the modern cancer treatment landscape. Interviews and surveys will be undertaken with research experts
column3: cancer doctors and patients about their views on this topic and analysed with respect to new implications which emerge of an ethical nature as well as the way in which research contributes to new knowledge."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2021964^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2021964"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving outcomes and experiences of Culturally and Linguistically Diverse patients affected by cancer participating in survivorship programs
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Cancer survivors who have completed treatment are at risk of complications for several years. Although cancer survivorship clinics have been established around Australia
column3: migrants of culturally and linguistically diverse (CALD) backgrounds
column4: experience unique challenges in navigating local health systems in the survivorship setting. This research aims to highlight the substantial unmet needs specific to CALD populations that are yet to be addressed in the current Australian healthcare system."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2021983^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2021983"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Clonal determinants of immune evasion to allogeneic stem cell transplant in acute myeloid leukaemia
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Patients with acute myeloid leukaemia (AML) who relapse after first line treatment have a very poor clinical outcome. A stem cell transplant offers the opportunity for cure
column3: however up to half of patients receiving this cellular immunotherapy have disease resistance or recurrence. This project will use a cutting-edge barcoding technique to track the genetic and non-genetic changes in each leukaemia cell over time to determine the mechanisms of immune evasion by AML."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2021986^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2021986"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Immune Related Adverse Events of the Gastrointestinal System and Investigation of Novel diagnostics and Therapeutics
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"This research project will explore the utility of intestinal ultrasound as a diagnostic tool of immune checkpoint inhibitor colitis. It will also explore the utility of faecal microbiota transplant in the management of immune checkpoint inhibitor colitis. It is expected that intestinal ultrasound will prove to provide an accurate and non invasive way of diagnosing this condition. It is also expected that faecal transplant will be effective in managing difficult to treat cases of this condition."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2021994^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2021994"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Primary Aldosteronism: New Strategies for Diagnosis and Management
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Primary aldosteronism (PA) is a common and curable form of high blood pressure
column3: requiring multiple tests for diagnosis. Lack of capacity for testing has led to delayed diagnosis and suboptimal outcomes
column4: especially among Indigenous Australians whose rate of PA is unknown. Treatment options for PA are also limited at present. My research will establish modern tools
column5: efficient pathways and novel therapies to improve health outcomes for all Australians with PA."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022019^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022019"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Characterising the perinatal
column2: neonatal and school-age childhood outcomes associated with diabetes in pregnancy
column3: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Diabetes in pregnancy is common and can lead to complications for mother and baby. Using population-based data from Victoria
column4: this dissertation seeks firstly to assess the long-term developmental and educational outcomes for children born to diabetic mothers. Management of diabetes confers improved perinatal outcomes
column5: and so this thesis will secondarily assess the efficacy of lesser used medications
column6: such as metformin
column7: with the view to improving treatment of diabetes in pregnancy."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022072^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022072"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Advanced magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) biomarkers for prediction of clinical outcomes after a first seizure
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"After someone has their first seizure
column3: we are unable to accurately predict who will go on to have further seizures (e.g.
column4: epilepsy) despite routine investigations. Cognitive and social problems often predate the first seizure. This project will develop a prediction tool using MRI brain scan markers
column5: that can be used in the clinic after someone experiences their first seizure. This may provide patients with a more accurate diagnosis
column6: individualise treatment and prevent cognitive deterioration."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022097^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022097"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"CD8+ T cell tolerance within the tumour draining lymph node as a novel immunotherapy target in colorectal cancer
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Immunotherapy
column3: a type of cancer treatment
column4: achieves remarkable outcomes for some patients
column5: though unfortunately not everyone benefits. An immune process called peripheral tolerance (PT) may be preventing the immune system from fighting cancer cells and reducing the benefit of immunotherapy. Our project aims to find out if PT is present in colorectal cancer and how it relates to patient outcomes. We will also define how to breach PT and explore new treatments in order to overcome this hurdle."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022099^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022099"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"The impact of gender affirming hormone therapy on scalp hair pattern and distribution
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Scalp hair loss in transgender individuals commencing testosterone for gender transition is poorly studied but has significant impacts on quality of life. Using novel artificial intelligence-assisted camera technology (HairMetrix)
column3: I will firstly document changes in scalp hair with gender affirming hormone therapy in trans men and in trans women. Following this
column4: I will undertake the first randomised clinical trial to prevent hair loss in trans men starting testosterone therapy."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022102^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022102"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Defining new therapeutic targets for ANCA-associated vasculitis
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Anti-neutrophil cytoplasmic antibody (ANCA)-associated vasculitis is an autoimmune disease that causes inflammation of small blood vessels. It often leads to severe kidney and lung inflammation and kidney impairment. While experimental disease models have identified new therapeutic options
column3: they have multiple limitations that are hindering therapeutic progress. This work will optimise new disease models
column4: define key mechanisms and identify new therapeutic targets in ANCA-associated vasculitis."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022109^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022109"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Advancing precision therapies for epilepsy
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Precision therapies targeting genetic abnormalities causing epilepsy may improve the outcomes of the medical treatment of epilepsy
column3: which have remained unchanged for decades. My project will evaluate the existing information for precision therapies in epilepsy and study potential precision approaches in patients with two severe genetic epilepsies. The results of this project may provide a pathway to realising the promise of precision medicine
column4: ultimately improving epilepsy treatment outcomes."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022116^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022116"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"The impact of post-school transitions on the mental health of young people with developmental disabilities
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Young people with developmental disabilities have poorer experiences of post-school transition and worse mental health compared to young people without disability. This PhD project will analyse survey data and conduct inclusive interviews with young people with development disabilities. The findings will provide evidence on the impact of post-school transitions on the mental health of young people with developmental disabilities."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022137^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022137"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Novel approaches to transfusion to improve supportive care for patients with blood cancers
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"The burden of blood cancers is increasing with an ageing Australian population. With new treatments available
column3: many older and more frail patients are accessing treatment for their disease. Transfusion is a mainstay of supportive care for people with blood cancers and one aspect of care that can be potentially be performed in the home. My research study involves the use of novel monitoring devices to monitor patients receiving transfusion
column4: and to pilot a program to transfuse patients at home."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022142^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022142"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Cardiovascular risk reduction in stroke survivors
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Many people who survive a stroke suffer heart disease in the next 10 years due to a high burden of vascular risk factors. Research in heart disease has identified effective ways to control these risk factors. Stroke survivors do not receive as much attention to these factors compared to heart attack survivors. The aim of our project is to implement a cardiologist-led clinic to reduce the risk of heart disease in stroke survivors. We will also classify risk in stroke survivors using new tools."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022150^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022150"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Novel Insights into Ischemia and No Obstructive Coronary Artery Disease
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Patients with Ischemia and No Obstructive Coronary Artery Disease (INOCA) are under-diagnosed and under-treated in current clinical practice. These patients continue to experience recurrent angina
column3: a poor quality of life and adverse cardiovascular outcomes. This project aims to improve our understanding of the burden of disease and the factors that drive its occurrence and progression. Our investigations will help inform future practice for INOCA patients
column4: including a novel diagnostic pathway."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022155^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022155"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Investigating methods to optimise and streamline transcatheter aortic valve implantation (TAVI)
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Transcatheter aortic valve implantation (TAVI) is a minimally invasive alternative to surgery for aortic valve narrowing. A common complication of TAVI is heart block (HB) requiring a pacemaker
column3: which is hard to anticipate. This project investigates novel predictors of HB after TAVI
column4: by monitoring patients for 2 years with an implantable heart monitor. Finally
column5: we will evaluate the viability of safe & early discharge in low risk patients
column6: with aims to reduce length of stay
column7: and streamline TAVI."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022156^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022156"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving outcomes for children with complex communication needs
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Speech & language disorders impact literacy
column3: social & work outcomes. The investigation of human genes can help us to understand why some children have speech & language disorders. My projects are: 1) Describe the speech & language profile of 2 genetic disorders (Batten Disease & Kleefstra Syndrome) 2) Complete a high-tech speech therapy trial in the genetic disorder Angelman's Syndrome 3) Create a high-tech therapy decision-making resource for speech pathologists."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022163^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022163"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Moving Towards Personalising Treatment for Patients with Pancreatic Cancer Using a Patient-Derived Tumour Explant Model
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Patients with pancreatic cancer (PC) have a poor prognosis. Our team has developed a world-first laboratory model of PC which we can use to test different chemotherapy drugs on a sample of a patient's tumour ("explant") with results available within 3 weeks. The overall aim of my PhD is to show our model can be used as a reliable indicator of how a patient will respond to different drug treatments
column3: and search for reasons why some patients have tumours that don't respond ("chemoresistance")."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022167^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022167"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Selective Serotonin Reuptake Inhibitors And Depression in Atrial Fibrillation: The SAD-AF randomised controlled trial
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"The SAD-AF study is trial of serotonin-based antidepressants in people with intermittent atrial fibrillation (AF) and at least moderate symptoms of depression
column3: to improve AF-related quality of life. AF is an irregular rhythm arising from the upper chambers of the heart
column4: and can cause symptoms of chest pain
column5: breathlessness and feelings of depression or anxiety. We believe that commonly prescribed serotonin-based antidepressants may improve AF-related symptoms and reduce the time spent in AF."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022178^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022178"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"The role of the Gut Microbiome in Irritable Bowel Syndrome and its therapeutic potential
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) is one of the most common gastrointestinal disorders. IBS patients have an altered gut microbiome
column3: but the potential of targetting microbiome changes to treat IBS is unclear. This PhD will evaluate faecal microbiota transplantation as a novel method of restoring healthy gut bacteria in IBS treatment and the role of dietary modifications. It will also lead to the creation of Australia’s first microbiome bank for IBS patients."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022186^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022186"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Investigating the effectiveness of systems-oriented implementation research and partnerships in malaria-endemic settings
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Malaria control interventions are falling short of impact and long-term sustainability as they lack systems integration and effective cross-program coordination. My research will provide evidence on; a) feasibility and acceptability of new vivax-specific tools
column3: b) effectiveness of systems-oriented implementation research and c) impact of research partnerships in PNG. This research will be critical to embed the coordination and systems approach required to achieve malaria elimination."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022193^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022193"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Saving sight: Novel stratification instruments for glaucoma
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Glaucoma is the leading cause of irreversible blindness globally. Predictors of disease progression remain poorly understood
column3: and monitoring is time and resource intensive. This project seeks to create an innovative predictive risk calculator which can be used to identify individuals at the highest risk of vision loss. The outcomes of this project will directly address existing gaps in knowledge and clinical practice
column4: and propose new approaches to glaucoma monitoring and resource allocation."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022228^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022228"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Digital health to assist recovery after critical illness
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"People who survive an Intensive Care Unit (ICU) admission often have physical and mental complications and poor health outcomes. Previous ICU recovery research is limited to in-person follow-up. Digital solutions may be a powerful mediator of ICU recovery by improving access to specialised recovery programs. This research aims to understand acceptability of digital programs
column3: and develop and test these. This research will improve outcomes for ICU survivors
column4: and will inform larger-scale research."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022235^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022235"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Three-Dimensional (3D) Printing to Refine Cardiac Assessment and Procedures
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"3D printing in cardiovascular medicine is still in its infancy. There is great scope for clinical applications of this technology and its use in developing the field of personalised medicine. First
column3: this technique needs to be refined and established. Studies to demonstrate effectiveness are required before this technology can become implemented into guidelines and widely adopted. The proposed research is expected to establish the optimal 3D printing strategy in cardiovascular medicine."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022237^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022237"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Defining the landscape of ANCA-associated vasculitides in Australia and providing a foundation for improved care
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"ANCA-associated vasculitis is caused by the body attacking itself in small blood vessels affecting multiple organs
column3: leading to deaths and ill health. A registry is being established to capture more information about this condition in Australia
column4: to gain insight into the extent of the disease locally and identify improvements to treatment. The plan is to link the data with an existing European registry to attain more meaningful results
column5: to investigate how to better treat this condition worldwide."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022238^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022238"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Nanoparticle and gene therapy approaches to HIV cure
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Current treatment for HIV is able to suppress but not eradicate HIV infection. This is because HIV is able to infect long-lived immune cells and maintain a reservoir of latent infection. One promising approach to target this reservoir is a form of gene therapy using CRISPR/Cas9. CRIPSR is able to target sequences of DNA
column3: including HIV. This project aims to develop a therapeutic approach using CRISPR/Cas9 and explore novel mechanisms for gene therapy delivery using nanoparticle technology."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022240^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022240"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Community
column2: Country
column3: and Cognition: A multi-jurisdictional assessment of dementia affecting Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples
column4: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"This study will be the first to evaluate nationwide dementia rates between Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander and non-Aboriginal people. Guided by community-identified priorities
column5: the study will evaluate risk factors for Aboriginal and non-Aboriginal Australians living with or developing dementia in NSW and Central Australia. This study will inform clinical practice and policy development to benefit dementia care for Aboriginal Australians across urban
column6: regional
column7: and remote settings."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022244^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022244"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Platelet biomarkers of thrombotic risk in type 2 diabetes
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Patients with diabetes face an increased risk of diseases linked to abnormal blood clotting
column3: such as heart attacks and strokes. Our initial studies show platelets from patients with diabetes
column4: which are hyperactive
column5: produce more inflammatory proteins such as CXCL3. This opens new opportunities for drugs to block platelet inflammation to prevent heart attacks
column6: with potentially fewer bleeding side-effects compared to traditional treatments."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022247^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022247"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Coronary artery mimicking blood clot test: A point-of-care prothrombotic prediction device for patient-specific diagnosis
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"This biomedical engineering program aims to develop a patient-specific biochip to diagnose and predict blood clot tendency at an earlier stage. The point-of-care prothrombotic prediction device will be suitable for patients with high blood clot risks such as diabetes and
column3: more recently
column4: the COVID-19. It also serves as a testing platform for new anti-platelet and anti-coagulant drugs
column5: and as a way for surgeons to screen patients for anti-thrombotic before operating to avoid uncontrolled bleeding."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022273^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022273"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Understanding the phenotypic expression of early disease and genetics of cardiac amyloidosis
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Cardiac amyloid is a multi-system disorder with poor survival that presents as heart failure
column3: rhythm issues or strokes. New treatments improving survival are available but costly. The prevalence of genetic mutations
column4: the best test and how to diagnose early disease is unclear. Cardiac amyloid patients and families will have genetic testing and cardiac imaging to identify the prevalence of mutations
column5: the best and earliest diagnostic tests and better explain heart changes associated with strokes."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022274^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022274"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Predicting progression of intestinal metaplasia to gastric cancer
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Stomach cancer is a rare type of cancer in Australia which is often diagnosed late and has a poor survival. Intestinal metaplasia is a change in the stomach which precedes cancer in some people. However
column3: the best way to monitor patients with this condition is not known. This project will try to understand why some people develop stomach cancer
column4: and how we should monitor patients with intestinal metaplasia. This will include developing a world-first model in the lab using cells from patients."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022279^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022279"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Generating the trial evidence end-users prefer: adding value to the analysis of a randomised controlled trial of patient-led surveillance for subsequent melanoma (MEL-SELF)
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Common ways of determining the success of new treatments for health problems do not always offer the most useful knowledge to patients and doctors. This research explores new ways of analysing research results. In doing so
column3: it aims to enhance the benefits of new treatments to patients
column4: doctors
column5: and policy makers."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022284^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022284"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Understanding the interplay between eating disorders and weight management therapy
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"We need better evidence to make sure that weight management therapy for obesity does not lead to eating disorders development. We aim to (1) identify which persons are at risk of eating disorders (2) break down the building blocks of weight management therapies and compare if these ‘blocks’ increase eating disorder risk (3) describe what healthcare professionals and patients think about these issues (4) describe the pathway to eating disorder development during weight management therapy."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022301^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022301"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Towards ending tuberculosis and leprosy in the Pacific – implementing the PEARL study in South Tarawa
column2: Kiribati
column3: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"South Tarawa
column4: the capital of Kiribati
column5: has the highest rates of tuberculosis (TB) and leprosy in the Pacific. My project will partner with the Kiribati government to offer community-based screening
column6: treatment and prevention for TB and leprosy to the entire population. We will measure the impact of this intervention on incidence and transmission rates of TB and leprosy in South Tarawa
column7: demonstrating a pathway for future disease elimination in the whole of Kiribati and other remote settings."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022307^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022307"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Precision diagnosis for children with hearing loss: optimising utilisation of imaging and genetic testing
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Hearing loss (HL) is relatively common in Australian newborns. Early and accurate detection and diagnosis of hearing loss optimizes care and developmental outcomes. Over 50% of HL is genetic with >120 genes known. Imaging findings and genetic testing can enhance our understanding of the cause
column3: providing families with precise diagnoses and family planning information. Up to 12% of genetic HL is due to an inner ear abnormality associated with specific genes
column4: but genetic testing is rarely offered."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022340^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022340"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Novel retinal imaging biomarkers for the assessment and prevention of diabetes complications
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"PREDICT is a major study of type 2 diabetes complications. Whilst diabetes management has improved tremendously
column3: our ability to identify those at risk of the sight- and life-threatening complications of the disease has not. Our goal is to develop better ways of estimating the risk of complications. We will use the rich data collected in PREDICT to determine if simple eye scans can be used for improved prediction. We will test new eye scanning technology and artificial intelligence methods."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022345^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022345"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"The effects of osteoanabolic pharmacotherapy and osteogenic exercise on bone and muscle outcomes in postmenopausal osteoporosis: exploring the bone/muscle interface
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Bone fractures
column3: particularly in women after menopause
column4: result in significant health-related disability. We need to get more benefit from current therapies for osteoporosis (bone fragility). We will investigate the effects of combining exercise with bone-building medication on improving bone mass and whether bone-building medication can improve muscle and physical function
column5: which may lend to reduction in falls. We are conducting a multi-centre study to help address these important questions."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022346^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2022346"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"PhD Community Sentiment Tool
